description:
I always come for the combination large pho bowl, and I've yet to be disappointed.  I actually highly prefer going to PPQ over Kevin's across the street.  The food is better, it's less crowded, and it feels less "manufactured".  At Kevin's you get your food in about 10 seconds, but at PPQ, there's the still the sense that they're actually cooking your food to order.  The service isn't the greatest, but after you put your order in, you should get your food pretty quickly (5-10 minutes).  

For about $10, you get a huge bowl of food.  The pho broth is definitely on the better side for San Francisco, and they aren't skimpy with the noodles or the meat either.  You get a pretty sizable portion of meat if you order the large bowl, and most of it is pretty good!  There is a decent amount of fatty beef slices that I prefer not to eat, but other than that I think the pho here is pretty solid and worth it at the prices they charge.

If you're a Kevin's regular, I would recommend giving PPQ a shot when you don't feel like waiting in line!
author: Tim L.

description:
1)  I did takeout on two orders.  One was for the beef pho and the other for beef tendons, tripe, etc.  Got the order, opened it up at my friend's place only to find out both were just the beef order.

2)  Years ago when i frequented this place, they were generous with the meat portions.  Now the meats are cut super thin and small and there's barely any in the soups at all.

3)  This is the worst and the reason why i won't returning.  I went into the restaurant for a bowl of pho in the early evening recently and was guided towards a table near the rear.  After i sat down and ordered, i could smell the rank stink coming out from what i assume was their bathroom.  It smelled like a hobo camp of piss and shit and was so horrible i could taste the smell.  How difficult was it to clean the bathroom and if they couldn't, close the bathroom up and spray it with frebreeze??  I should have just got up and left, but tried to power my way through the pho while the bathroom stink wafted towards me and the rest of the diners.  Gross.  I won't step foot back here ever again.
author: Animal K.

description:
We tried their Satay Beef Pho & their Chicken curry Pho. The best is actually their "imperial rolls". The fried rolls take delicious than they look. 

The Satay beef had the sauce from the Chinese hot pot which tastes good but high calorie though.

I would recommend people to get the medium size bowl because the Large is like a pool.
author: Julie L.
Wesley S.

description:
Came on a Sunday night around 7pm and there were a few empty tables so we didn't have to wait!

TBH, I've past by this place soooo many times and never put two and two together that this was the second location for PPQ! Whattttt! However, I am glad that I've finally tried and it! 

I heard so much about the garlic noodles that that's exactly what I wanted and got. The choice of meat was a bit more difficult to decide upon. I opted for the charbroiled pork while my friend's got the five spice chicken. When our dishes came, I went to work on it! Had to try the garlic noodles and they were delicious! The meat on the other hand, was good, but I just wasn't completely satisfied with it. I tried my friend's chicken and it was delicious! I would recommend the five spice chicken over the pork. Next time, I know what I'm getting!
author: Karen Y.

description:
PPQ is one of the best spots in the city for authentic Vietnamese pho. I'm a native and I've been here multiple times with friends and family. Their appetizers, noodle soups, and rice plates are all scrumptious. My best friend and I have always gravitate back to the five spice chicken pho - it is much like a Vietnamese Tom Kha broth.

The area has awful parking during prime times and there's a lot around the corner but I would plan ahead. They have a decent amount of seating but I would not recommend dining here with a group larger than six because your tables will be split. They have a clipboard during high volume times.

Their staff is very attentive, although during busy nights may fall behind just given the sheer demand and size of the restaurant.
author: Navila H.

description:
I came here on a Saturday at around noon. The place was pretty busy but i was seated immediately. I ordered their Imperial rolls as an appetizer and #1 Pho Combination large size for me and medium for my friend. 
The food was delivered pretty quickly. The rolls were great - crispy and stuffed with fresh ingredients. The large soup was humongous - i could only finish 3/4 of it. The various meat in the soup was fresh and tasty. However, the broth was very salty - almost too much. So i solid 4 stars.
author: George B.

description:
I dined here recently and ordered garlic noodles with chicken and garlic noodles with beef. 

The noodles weren't garlicky and the chicken wasn't five spicey. As others have mentioned, the beef portion is small. 

By these two dishes alone, I give this place 3 stars and would recommend Perilla (Irving & 10th) for garlic noodles.

Also, Perilla serves their garlic noodles with broccoli. PPQ serves lettuce.
author: Lexy C.

description: Their pho broth is the best I've ever had. My fiancé and I come here regularly. I typically get #11 which is rare steak pho. My fiancé pretty much rotates thru the menu. One thing we almost always get are the imperial rolls. They do serve beer here unlike the place across the street. You can also order the broth to go.
author: Angela T.

description:
PPQ always delivers just the PHO i love! Huge fan of their raw beef capriccio for a starter. For pho I always stick with their Number 1 M which is plenty of food or their five spices chicken garlic noodle if I'm not feeling PHO. 

Perks: 
They have a huge TV which played NBA when I was eating!
They accept credit card
Fast service
author: Linsey F.

description:
My friend and I stopped here because it was on Thrillist list of best pho in the area. This restaurant is on Irving Street and it's typically hard to find parking but we got lucky and got princess parking. Upon walking in, we were greeted and seated immediately. They have a great variety of food on their menu. After a few minutes of looking at the menu, our waitress took our order. I ended up ordering the #4 (beef and beef ball pho with flat noodle) and my friend got the #1. We also got the PPQ wings (crispy fried wings). 

While we were there, there were quite a few people there. We were excited to get our food. Our soups came out first! Yaya! Short and simple: my pho was okay. And, my friend said the same about hers. The broth was very hot and it wasn't bad but it wasn't the best pho I've ever had. It was just okay. As for their wings -- those were bombdotcom. 

Overall, the service was okay and the food was okay (except the wings, those were really good). However, I would definitely go back to try their rice plates. I highly recommend trying their chicken wings. That made the trip worth it all on it's own
author: Misty T.

description:
My girlfriend and I have frequented this pho place for a long time. Normally, there really isn't anything to complain about. Tonight, however, ruined our image of the restaurant. The waiter and waitress that took turns tending to our table, gave our order to the table behind us. Realizing this, the waiter takes the bowl of noodles to a counter, places it down for a minute, and brings it back over to me.. Then while we were eating already, they drop down a plate of spring rolls that we did not order hastily on our table and rushes away. It was left there for about 5 minutes. The waitress takes the spring rolls, takes it to a counter nearby for a minute, and picks it up to give to the table behind us. I was healing from a cough.

I would like to say that my immune system is pretty strong. The only time I have thrown up in my adult life was eating a bowl of noodles from here. I didn't think or care too much about it at the time. But now I think I know why I regurgitated their food.

If staff at PPQ practice this kind of improper food handling in public, imagine what they do in the back.

Unfortunately, even though we like their food, we are now afraid to go back.
author: Kev L.

description:
Beef Carpaccio is absolutely to die for.

Add this in with a crab paste noodle soup with egg noodles & you got my favorite cold day meal. Or you know, nursing a hangover.
author: Alex H.

description: Poor customer service, please be nice to the clientele, I told my my friends about how good the food was here but when we arrived there was no greet, the gentleman at the register seemed bothered by my friends questions, not everybody knows about pho, my friends are Eastern European and they don't have Vietnamese restaurants in their countries so they had questions. But did see how the waitress interacted with other customers, at least she was consistent with her rude behavior, I think this is accepted in their community but not in ours. Definitely not recommending this place any longer nor coming back!!!.
author: Karl H.

description:
I had lunch at PPQ a couple of times with my coworkers.  It's pretty good!

Usually when I visit any Vietnamese restaurant,  I get their garlic noodles, but I was more intrigued to get their baked egg loaf combo dish since I've never had it before.

Com Bi Thit Cha -- http://bit.ly/2qRTihz
shredded pork, charbroiled pork, baked egg loaf rice plate
Oh yeah, this was good!  The baked egg loaf was very savory and I liked how it was stuffed with vermicelli noodles.  It went well all together with the shredded pork and charbroiled pork.  This quickly became a favorite of mine and I enjoyed it so much that I ordered it again when I returned for another lunch.

Overall, PPQ is a great lunch and dinner spot.  Service here was very quick and the food has been excellent.  I have no serious complaints.  I haven't tried their other entrees yet, but I've seen their bun bowls and garlic noodles and they looked amazing with generous portions!  I'll definitely consider trying those out in future visits.
author: Rodney H.

description:
Um...Yum! I would totally come back here.  

I got the Curry Chicken Pho and it was super good. It's a bit on the spicy side - so if you hate spice, not for you - but was the perfect balance for me - spicy, but didn't overwhelm the dish. I was also really impressed with the chicken - not over cooked. The whole thing came together just really well - like I said, I would totally eat this again.

Husband got the more normal Pho - he also enjoyed it. We also got some pork spring rolls which I think were pretty standard.

Real plus here is they are open till 11! yay! And guess what? They were quite busy at 9:45pm on a Wednesday when we came in.
author: Sarah C.

description:
This review is based on their Curry Chicken Vermicelli Noodle Soup (#8) - it's my favorite noodle soup from this restaurant. It's spicy and unique in flavors, but the curry isn't overpowering. I usually don't like potatoes but the ones they serve you in this soup is quite delicious. So whenever I'm in the bay area and craving soup, I usually come here for their curry chicken noodle soup :) 

The wait isn't bad at all - I've never had to wait longer than 5-10 minutes for a table. They're very quick in service.

Parking is annoying around this area though.
author: Chariya S.

description:
We have been coming to PPQ for many years, and have not disappointed once. The service was very fast which was great especially when you were hungry! Sometimes there would be a line but it moved fast too. 

My all time favorite is their chicken curry vermicelli noodle with a side dish of five spice chicken. The noodle soup has a nice balance of coconut flavor and lemongrass flavor with a hint of spicy taste and came with white meat chicken. Very delicious and keeping me come back for more. My hubby's favorite is their rare flank steak pho as he doesn't care for tripes and tendons. 

I also tried their various pho noodle soup and all of them are very good (basically the same broth and noodle, just different kinds of meat obviously) the broth has good flavor and taste and the meats are good quality. Neighborhood jam in the Sunset.
author: Lena H.

description:
This place didn't treat me well and he talked in Chinese with my girlfriend make feeling totally uncomfortable because I don't speak it.
So bad service and request for tip.
I really didn't like the service.
I would recommend you go somewhere else.
The owner came out of the store to argue w me.
The service wasn't good I didn't pay tip.
And he was very racist to me .
Asking me where I was from.
It was not he business where I am from.
So far the worst place I have ever been.
He said to everyone in this store that I didn't pay tip.
I would never pay tip to that kind of service.
If you want have this kind of bad service you can try it or go somewhere batter.
author: Guilherme R.

description:
It's my first time here and The food here are excellent! 
I recommended! This place is busy and suggest call make reservations. Lines is crazy busy.
author: Maribeth G.

description:
They were able to accommodate my group of 12 as a walk in on a Sunday night, which was awesome considering the flow of guest being consistent.

The pho dishes came out within a few minutes of ordering. I received my order of garlic noodles and five spice quickly as well. While the 10 of us enjoyed our meals, the other 2 waited. Most of us finished our food before they got theirs!

I was able to try 2 dishes: 

Garlic Noodles with 5 Spice Chicken: The chicken was juicy, well seasoned, and topped with a crunchy skin. The garlic noodles, unfortunately, lacked a bit in flavor. 

Bun Bo Hue: Broth tasted just like pho but spicy. It had good flavor but didn't enjoy how the seasoning settled to the bottom. If you stir the soup your spoon would serve you a bit of grit.

Would I come back? Ehh... maybe
author: Mary R.

description:
I go here when I want spicy broth that isn't ramen or curry. I always order a medium #7 Five Spice Chicken Noodle Soup and ask for curry broth for an extra $0.95. If I want a more traditional pho, I go across the street to Kevin's because I'm a grad student and those prices speak to me more. 

I recently cane here with a friend and ordered the imperial rolls for sharing. Those things are yum! 

I gotta say that despite the higher price for pho and the inattentive service, I like this place. Took a star away for these factors, but their curry pho and five spice chicken combo is so good, I'll always come back for it. Makes my curry loving palette happy.
author: Jess G.

description: This is where you go in San Francisco for grubbin Vietnamese phood/ pho. Nothing fancy at all - 5 spice chicken, pork spring rolls are go to items. Take credit cards which is a plus
author: Matt T.

description:
~~~ALWAYS CHECK YOUR RECEIPTS~~~

Let me first start with the food. I used to love getting their curry pho, but it seems to be inconsistent.. sometimes it's spicy with a lot of coconut flavor, other times not spicy and much less coconut. Then sometimes not spicy and too much coconut lol ya know what I mean! It's a mix of inconsistency, but at least the meat is always tender! They use different noodles for the curry pho than regular pho. The noodles used in the curry pho are smaller and usually seem to be cooked a bit too long, making them soft and mushy. I opted for something new and tried the Satay pho, and I actually enjoyed it more than the curry pho. There wasn't anything about the soup that made it very memorable, but it's a refreshing change if you're used to getting the curry pho, and also because I prefer the regular pho noodles.

My two stars for this review actually comes from the service/cashier. Aside from the usual not-so-kind service, we saw a discrepancy in our total and how much we were charged. Our total for four people was $68 and some change (yes we were hella hungry), we split the check in two cards and were charged $35 each.. but 35 x 2 = 70 amirite?? Unless math has changed over the years

An extra $2 isn't a huge deal, but we wanted an explanation. If they made a mistake, that would be fine but when we asked the cashier why we were charged $35 each when our total was $68 something, she said "oh, I thought it was $69.?? so we rounded up to 70."

What in the!!!!!! Since when did places start rounding up totals?! Even if you thought our total was $69 and some change, THEN YOU NEED TO CHARGE US FOR $69 AND SOME CHANGE. $2 may not seem like a lot or noticeable, but imagine if they charged 100 customers an extra $2, they're cashing in an extra $200 a day!! I'm Vietnamese with relatives that work at or own pho restaurants so I'm ashamed to see this. Girl you got that calculator right next to your register, don't play us!!
author: Cassie T.

description: We finally gave this place a try and we have a mixed review. My daughter tried their #4 (thin slices of beef and meatball pho) and I tried the #32 (charbroiled shrimp garlic noodles). I would have to say that my dish was very satisfying, there was a large portion of noodles and seven flavorful shrimps it also came with a small side salad, it had good flavor. My daughter was not unhappy but not satisfied with her dish. There was only three meatballs and there was a few very small slices of beef in her soup. The broth wasn't to her liking, it was heavy on the spice flavor rather than beef flavor and the soup felt heavy and filling, not light and fresh. The noodles were clumped together and hard to pick up but all in all it wasn't too bad. Since I was satisfied with my dish I gave it three stars, but I most likely won't be going back for anything but their garlic noodles. Random side note, when we asked for our waters to be refilled the waiter only filled our cups a little more than halfway up; since it was only one specific person it's not that big of a deal but just kind of odd.
author: David H.

description: My hubby doesn't use yelp so I'm really posting this for him. He's obsessed with the raw beef dish at Vietnamese places and not all places serve them so when we were at the golden gate park with some friends visiting, he decided he wanted to take them here to try it (2 hours before our dinner reservation). I'm preggos atm so I couldn't try it and to be honest I'm generally not a fan of carpaccio or beef tartare. I've tried it in the past and I totally get the appeal and I love sashimi but still just not fully comfortable with the idea. Hubby ordered two plates for the table and wow they devoured them like tigers being fed at the zoo. Apparently it's perfect and the more lime the better. Needless to say he can't wait to come back.
author: Jennie C.

description: PPQ - classic pho spot in SF's Sunset District. I am almost positive that this is where I had my first ever bowl of pho many years back. Just recently, my boyfriend and I came in just after getting off a plane from Florida. We were on the verge of getting a gnarly post-travel bug and needed to get our pho-fix. All the other Vietnamese restaurants in the Daly City/SSF area were closed since it was past 9pm, so we drove into the city to good ol Irving Street. For a late Thursday night, the restaurant was packed and lively. I ordered a bowl of the chicken pho and we shared a plate of garlic noodles w grilled pork. Thank goodness PPQ has later hours, or we would have gone to bed sick and sad. Instead, we slept easy and were very much satisfied.
author: Camille B.

description:
What used to be one of my favorite SF Pho places has not only changed their menu with increased prices but the pho and Bun Bo Hue are now smaller portions with watered down soup broth. On the bright side, service seems to be better b/c the wait staff are younger and fluent in English.

The large combination pho which was previously somewhere around $10 is now $11.50. I wouldn't mind the cost increase if it tasted as good as I remembered but sadly the quality has declined. The meat was about 1/2 the quantity of what it used to be and the broth is nowhere near as flavorful as before.

Still an acceptable pho but the other pho places on the same street are able to deliver a better quality product with better value. 

I hope someone at PPQ takes note and takes appropriate corrective action to justify being one of the most expensive pho in SF now.
author: Benny M.

description:
The last night I had to leave town for yet another transpacific trip I decided to eat at a casual suburb place with a friend who had been showing me this part of town. I always felt a bit lost in here, not quiet Asia yet filled with Asian things. I was delighted by how unusual the dishes they had on the offering. I did like the carpaccio. The vermicelli plates were good and predictably Caucasian friendly.

A younger colleague told me that PPQ was one of her favorites, I always thought that she's a good judge for Vietnamese food as she's Vietnamese. I do think there are some to be said about the all around crowd pleasing fried chicken wings side menu. To me, it's a signal of rather non authentic spot. But I was wrong. I really did like the wings. They were delicious. And the best was the egg rolls. Very crunchy and light. 

I know Kevin's noodle house is next door, but to my non-Asian friend who came with me, this place was a bit more approachable. I'd just come here for a plate of raw beef, very delightful, delicious and smooth. Way better than the overpriced beef carpaccio you find in an average Italian restaurant.

Sold!
author: Victoria E.

description: My girlfriend and I ordered their signature pho and the curry chicken noodle soup. Both were incredibly bland. We had to dump about half a bottle of sriracha before there were any flavors. The restaurant also smelled funny, which got me wondering about their health score. Turns out they only have a 74/100, and one of their violations is risk of vermin infestation! Safe to say I will not be coming back here.
author: Carl W.

description:
A great family friendly Vietnamese restaurant if you are in the sunset area! Definitely recommend the five spices chicken garlic noodle - it had good flavor and the noodles were soft and well seasoned. The cabbage salad with chicken was also delicious with a slightly tangy dressing. All the spring rolls were tasty with either peanut or fish sauce and the noodle soups were delectable as well. For vegetarians, you can request a vegetable based broth as an alternative to the beef or chicken broth. All in all, our family had a great meal! 

For parking there's a metered public lot on 20th between Irving and Lincoln.
author: Sarah K.

description:
The short: good pho and bonus that it's open late

After an impromptu flurry of texts, hunger pangs from not eating dinner and a responsibility to find a place with the criteria of: open at 10:30pm, near/in Sunset, offers hearty soothing warm comfort food, I found PPQ. 

At pho places, my default is the #1 bowl with everything. There was so much on the menu that I wanted to try but for the sake of time (I was on a time crunch), I chose #1. PPQ Beef Combo Noodle Bowl (medium) was no disappointment. Granted, a lot of things taste good when I'm hungry and goes straight from utensil to mouth (sorry, no pics to accompany this review!). There was a good proportion of meat to noodles, though the soup broth was on the salty side. Another plus: good price point! My friend also enjoyed their order. So happy to have introduced them to a good pho spot.

Plenty of servers walking around, ambiance is casual, and when we went on a Thursday evening, more than half the tables were occupied.

Tip: split checks accepted!

Verdict: wouldn't mind coming back to become more familiar with the menu items and for that lovely bowl of pho
author: Catherine W.

description:
I've been coming here my whole life. PPQ is my to go place with my family when we don't want to cook and want something quick for dinner. 

In my opinion, PPQ's pho taste a bit "healthier" than other pho places. The soup is not too salty or fatty. In other words, I don't feel like I am eating/drinking msg! 

But, what I love from here is the Chicken Curry Vermicelli Noodle Soup! The curry flavor is not too strong, but it is very flavorful. And, if you like spicy, it has a hint of spice that I like. I recommend this to all my friends. 

I also like the Five Spice Chicken Pho. Chicken (on the side) is BOMB and greasy, but it balances out well with the pho. 

Favorite appetizer is the Imperial Rolls (egg rolls). Just try it. I can't think of a restaurant that has better imperial rolls.
author: Darlene T.

description:
SCAM ALERT !!!!! SCAM ALERT !!!!!!! SCAM ALERT!!!!

Watch out if you pay your Bill using debit or credit card. 

I've been a long time customer of this place.
I Don't have any complaints of the food at all. With a exception of a couple of the Waitresses Also don't have any problems with the service, in fact I find them to be very friendly and been pleased with the service.

But I noticed something for the first time yesterday and this prompted me to dig into old bank statements 

Since I've been a long time customer and have my usual go to items I never bother to look at the menu (at prices of items) I often pay cash and tip with cash. (And I always tip on the higher end) 

But lately I've been paying with debit or credit card.
So yesterday the waitress brings out the bill to my table 
With the itemized list, total amount including tax. I leave her my debit Card. 

she comes back with that bill plus the receipt after the transaction With my debit card. I noticed on the receipt the amount was different ... it was more ... apparently the cashier added a 20% tip and when I received the receipt
It only shows the total amount with the 20% added and 
Has line to add tip and signature WHAT THE HELL?!?!

Being a long time regular and ordering pretty much the same go to items and felt the establishment was honest guess I usually don't inspect my bill just drop the cash and look at the receipt (not itemized bill) and Tip according to my receipt. 

Usually when they bring my change or return my card with just the receipt not receipt and original bill. 

So yesterday was the first time I caught this! That they have been placing a 20% tip on my bill already before I add my own 20% or higher tip. 

I looked at old bank statements which confirmed it. In fact on one of the bills I was really taken.

I added a to go item as the bill came out. so when they returned with the receipt I added a 20% tip.

they not only took out 20% already for my meal but also another 20% for the to go item so I basically paid a 60% tip according to my bank statement. Pretty shady practice 

I will never return to this establishment ever again
author: Tommy G.

description: Although it was weekend evening and pretty busy, it didn't take too long to get seated. Ordered a flank dish and it was decent! this review is mainly for the plants up in front. Why get fake ones? They just collect dust! Get real ones, and you'll have less dusting to do :) 4 out of 5 due to plants that could have been better. With legit plants, I would have received the pho effect
author: Tidus H.

description:
Delicious pho in a place which is very simple when you first see it. It has great value for money and very delicious noodle bowls. It's located on the very active Irving street. 

I tried the crispy chicken and loved it. 9/10
We also got the pork summer roll from the appetiser list and that was super 9/10. It has a mint addition to the toll which I loved. 

I have been back 2 times since and tried the beef satay noodle bowl 8/10 and the chicken curry bowl with coconut milk 8/10. 

The prices are also very good, one bowl medium size ranges from $8.50-$9.00 approximately and this is a full meal. 

Note : The portions are HUGE so I always get the medium and not large for myself. 
They serve hot tea with the meal and it's free of charge. You just need to ask the server. 

Must visit if you like pho and authentic experiences minus all the frills. Will certainly go back !
author: Shivani B.

description:
I came here to grab dinner with my cousin and her boyfriend on a Sunday night. We got seated right away.
I highly suggest coming hungry! Don't judge this place on the appearance because be prepared for amazing food.

Food I ordered:

Curry chicken vermicelli noodle soup (5/5)
It was a good mix of sweet and hint of spicy

Five spice chicken garlic noodles (5/5)
The chicken was perfectly cooked. Crispy skin on top and tender meat on the bottom. It was probably the best chicken I've had at any pho place I have been to in NYC.
The garlic noodles were an excellent compliment to the dish! 

The reason I gave this place 3 stars was because the service wasn't great. I waved to get a server's attention and she gave me eye contact but ignored me and kept talking to the other workers. I had to ask the server several times for water and utensils.
author: Chloe C.

description:
I think I like PPQ way more than Kevin's Noodle House across the street mainly because there's so many more options besides the standard #1 pho. They have some variety in menu options from curry chicken pho to five spice chicken garlic noodles. It's a smaller space and it can get crowded and their tables are really meant for 1-4 people and not large groups. Service is friendly and the food is good. This is definitely going up there on my list of go to pho spots. They don't have small bowls for the noodle soups, only medium and large. Prices are very reasonable at under $10 and super filling (a medium is more than enough for me). 

CURRY CHICKEN PHO
I'm a big fan of coconut and curry and this definitely hits the spot for that craving.

CRAB NOODLE SOUP
Or Bun Rieu. I found the flavor a bit underwhelming in this because I wanted a stronger flavor. Still good though. Something to note is that the vermicelli noodles are a bit thicker and firmer than the standard pho noodles I am used to. 

FIVE SPICE CHICKEN GARLIC NOODLES
You can get five spice chicken pho or garlic noodles although with the pho version, you get the five spice chicken on the side and the pho is just regular beef noodle soup with nothing else in it. Their garlic noodles are tasty and so is their five spice chicken. A little more pricier than a bowl of pho but worth it if you're not craving pho.
author: Diana C.

description: Mixed feelings.  The pho is good.  But the sour attitude from the woman, who appears to be the owner, is distasteful.  Be sure to check your credit card receipts, as others have mentioned. I was charged double.  When I notified said woman above, she looked at me as if I had just spit in her pho.
author: Eric C.

description: #8 Spicy Curry chicken with Vermicelli Noodles, The medium serving is big as hell and so good!! As for me I always need a crunch, you know I couldn't pass up on the Imperial Rolls.
author: Tatianni D.

description: I can now see why this is my one of my best friends favorite place. They always serve their pho boiling hot. This may not seem important but it is important to have hot broth esp when you have the noodles at room temperature before you add the broth. Otherwise the noodles stick together and it's not a great pho experience. Also for an Asian restaurant service is great. I always make a few edits to my order and every single time they accommodate my changes and don't charge me extra for making a change. Side note, I usually ask for no noodles and an extra plate of bean sprouts since I am watching my carb intake. And when I bring friends who eat carbs they don't mind putting my noodles on the side for me to give to my friends who want extra noodles. The food quality here is good. I always order the rare beef and tendon or 5 spice chicken. If I am eating carbs my favorite is their pork and egg roll plate. It's so good! The pork has so much flavor and you can tell it's been marinated with a lot of care. My husband loves their spicy beef noodles and curry noodles. Everything here is delicious and made with care!
author: Jen C.

description:
Do not come here expecting top-notch service or ambiance.  Do come here if you are hungry and if your wallet is light.  Parking can be a challenge on busy Irving near 19th Ave.  So find a space and get ready to chow down.

Fo lunch we had:
- 5 Spice Chicken / Imperial Rolls Bun - the chicken was moist, tasty and had a nice fried skin layer.  Two tasty Imperial Rolls come with the Bun.  The rolls were large and crunchy.  Also lots of noodles.  Could eat a plate of Imperial Rolls by itself and I would be happy.
- Garlic Noodles with Grilled Pork - lots of garlicky spaghetti noodles with tasty slices of grilled pork.  A hefty plate according to my tummy.  Noodles were a little dry but you're here for the garlic...

No frills, no smiles, just get seated, look thru the menu, wave to the waitress, wave to the waitress again, order, eat, drink, burp, wave for your check, wave for your check again, get your check, pay your bill, move your bigger butt than before out of there....
author: Scott L.

description:
I would like to like it here, but I am still uncertain after a few visits. I really think it depends on the item you get. The pho is good here (to my recollection), but I agree that other food is not as good as pho.

This time I got the #50 seasoned vegetables with fried tofu. It comes with a side of rice. The dish came out and it wasn't what I expected. It was basically a stir fry of beans sprouts, cabbage, onion, carrot, celery, the clear rice noodles, and a pathetic shredded piece of fried tofu. The taste was very oily and had that stir-fry taste. I tried my best to finish it but I just couldn't and gave it to my family to eat. 

I pictured a better stir fry, something with bigger pieces of veggies in some sort of gravy. I guess I should have checked out other photos before selecting this.
author: Spencer H.

description:
Pretty good! I come once in a while if I'm not feeling like traditional chicken / beef pho.

I come here for the curry chicken noodles (like laksa) and garlic noodle with 5 spice chicken. This meal is quite heavy though so come hungry. Definitely not a regular thing for me since it's so fatty, but really great on a chilly night. Ironic that it's called PPQ Beef Noodle, because I thought the beef pho I got was the worst of the dishes I've tried. 

4 stars for food, 2 stars for service which is consistently slow and inattentive.
author: Claudia C.

description:
All I gotta say is the 5 spice chicken is OMGAWD so with garlic noodles or pho. That's all you need. Get your food and get out of there. 

Pros - 

1. 5 spice chicken with garlic noodles and some hot wings for appetizers and you're set. 

2. All the waitresses were so nice! Like unbelievably nice. There is a language barrier but everyone was super cool and helpful and just so sweet. 

3. Reasonably priced 

4. A lot of seating 

5. Finally an Asian restaurant that takes card!!!!!!

Cons - 

1. Parking is a beach*

2. Only one toilet area and it's not so clean looking but honestly...everything else was great so I don't care 

I don't know about everyone else but I had a great experience here
author: Andrew G.

description: Had the Bun Bo Hue. It's did not disappoint! The perfect balance of heat and flavors, the dish was served in a huge bowl, looking every bit as delicious as it tasted. Also ordered the chicken curry which as equally excellent. There's usually a wait to get seated and for good reason. Wonderful food at reasonable prices.
author: Bo B.

description:
Parking is nightmare as usual around 19th Ave & Irving.

Prices are a bit high compared to comparable Vietnamese restaurants in the area. 

It gets crowded, so get there early.  Note there is only 1 bathroom for the entire restaurant... so that is NOT a good thing... I am actually taking a way a star for the this lack of convenience and customer service.  There is always a line for it and its really messy inside and bit dark (should really have better wattage on the bulb).

We got there around 7PM on a Friday night, they were already out of the seafood pho, imperial rolls and fresh spring rolls.

I ordered the 5-spiced chicken over rice.  The chicken was boneless and grilled.  Giving it a smokiness.  The chicken tasted "aged" a least I hope it was dry aging to improve the Chicken Flavor, just like what they do to steaks... right.
author: Jerry W.

description: the best pho in sf!!!! we drive from south city and eat pho here. love the coconut pho and their 5 spice chicken!! my fave!!!!
author: Foodie Sushi Q.

description: Since my last review, the staff has gone through some changes. There are new faces among the servers and the ones that run the registers. The food is good and I am hoping their next Health Score is better.
author: Rob S.

description: This is one of our go to places on Sunday. They have really good five spice chicken and a wide variety of noodles. Even though it's a small restaurant they are very accommodating to us with the kids and the multiple strollers we have. My wife loves the vermicelli there with the imperial rolls.
author: Phoutty K.

description:
Ordered the bun rieu, pho #1, and chicken wings. 

Pros 
- food was quick to come out
- no wait to be seated
- chicken wings were crisp and juicy
- they have bun rieu 
- generous portion sizes

Cons
- bun rieu was a little lacking in flavor and one dimensional
- pho is better at Kevin's 
- health inspector score is 74 

To be honest, the only reason I came here was because they serve bun rieu. Is it just me or do a lot of places in sf not serve bun no hue and bun rieu?! So I'm happy they have it if I'm desperately craving it, but I was a little disappointed in the taste. Less fishy/ crabby and less sweet than Yummy Yummy's on Irving. Not really sure where I'd choose to go if I was craving bun rieu as neither places really hit the spot for me. The pho was okay, just typical pho. If I wanted that I'd rather go to Kevin's as their pho tastes a little more flavorful even if there might be a longer wait. The chicken wings we ordered as an appetizer were pretty good though. Not too much flavor aside from what a plain chicken wing tastes like, but dipping it in the fish sauce or adding a little salt and pepper made it better. Whatever they use to fry it up makes it crispier than your typical chicken wing too. Will I come back? Maybe, maybe not. Don't think this is really a place I'll crave.
author: Sandy K.

description:
I'm sorry but if this is an authentic Vietnamese restaurant I don't understand why they do not have broken rice with the basic toppings that all Viet places have. After a long day at work I was waiting for the moment I could finally eat the broken rice place with beef, shredded pork, and egg loaf with the pickled veggies that it always comes with. Unfortunately I never got to eat that because they didn't have it which I was appauld about. Maybe I'm being too harsh (maybe I'm just a little hangry) but what kind of viet place doesn't have this dish?! Ended up getting a janky beef rice plate that I ate angrily because I just could not get over it...

Maybe it's not a thing up here in norcal to have these broken rice plates but I was so upset and disappointed that they did not have it. I guess I looked at the old menu pictures which showed that they used to have it. And to top it off the rice that it came with wasn't even broken rice it was just Jasmine rice. Would not come back.
author: Allison L.

description:
It's been a while since I've been to PPQ because I usually go to Kevin's noodles across the street for the Pho. My friends wanted to come here for their five spice chicken curry pho. The wait was around 10-15 minutes so it wasn't too bad. We all ordered the same entree and were starving to get our foods. Once the food came, it was demolished within minutes. The Five spice chicken curry pho is interesting. At first i thought it was going to be very flavorful, but to my surprise, it was actually a balanced taste. The chicken was cooked to be slightly crisp which went really well with the curry soup base. 

With the good experience, I may be coming back for round 2. Perhaps I should have given this place a chance earlier.
author: Auden W.

description: This place is usually packed whenever my friends and I roll through, but today was perfect -- not too many people so our order came right on time. Got the vermicelli and wow it came within 3 minutes after! Excellent service!
author: Michael G.

description:
With apologies to yelper Mike L, I finally made it to PPQ.  

Long ago, Mike L saw my 5-star review for PPQ's across-the-street neighbor, Kevin's Noodle House, and recommended I try PPQ sometime.  From his 24+ check-ins at PPQ it's clear he's found something at PPQ he really likes (per his review,  Satay Beef Pho - #5) and I wish I'd read his review before I ordered.  My Pho, Rare Flank Steak & Meatballs (Pho Tai Bo Vien, $8 or $9.25), failed to wow me.  The broth wasn't flavorful and the meatballs were an odd, light color of indeterminate origin.  I was that person doctoring up my bowl with every sauce on the table, not my usual style.  

Around me, every table was taken.  It's true that Kevin's was closed that night but I suspect that wasn't the driver.  I choose instead to believe that diners fall either into the PPQ camp or the Kevin's camp and I'm in the latter.  

There's a lot of other things on PPQ's large menu.  Were Kevin's again closed I'd give first consideration to that Satay Beef Pho and then move off the pho entirely.  

I love an inexpensive place as much as anyone and PPQ qualifies.  PPQ is my new write-in candidate when Kevin's is closed and I'm craving pho.  If your heart isn't feeling Kevin's you'll likely love PPQ.
author: Tracey A.

description: I love this place for the rare flank Pho and come here to order it at least once a month-- the broth is excellent, the steak is fresh sliced, and their garnishes feel like they're grown in a garden and picked fresh each morning. I usually order their Imperial rolls to pair with it, but also really love pork rolls as well. I haven't explored the rest of the menu yet, just because whenever I'm here I want to order my favorite Pho, but I'll get around to it eventually :)
author: Virginia J.

description: It's really a shame that the service here is bad, because the food is actually decent. I like getting the garlic noodles here. I had a bad experience here where I called ahead to place an order to pick up. I got there and they gave me the wrong order. When I said I ordered something else, the woman snapped at me and said it was an error on my end. Later on, she realizes I did place the order correctly and it was the restaurant staff that messed it up (she then proceeded to yell at her staff in a different language and it seemed like there was some arguing). She told me to wait and really showed no sympathy for me. I ended up having to wait a long time for the food to be prepared. At that point, it's just not worth it. Poor, poor service.
author: Lillian B.

description: Good pho noodles and good price. Parking in the area can be a task but worth the hassle. Overall, good pho. They flavor of the broth is genuine and tasty unlike some pho places.
author: Andrew M.

description:
Not sure WHAT the hell happened here, and please skip this review if you dont want to be grossed out but I ordered the bun rieu, it was ok, soup couldve been hotter, flavors could have been bolder but the most crazy part is...after 2 days I am still shitting out the red oil they put into the soup.  I guess maybe they put too much but DAM...2 days...i dont even get this when i eat boiling crap or other pure oily mixtures of sauces.

So I'd say, get their pho, vermicelli, or rice plates maybe avoid the bun rieu just in case.  Their garlic noodles wit 5 spice chicken also taste just as good at perilla FYI.
author: Vince L.

description:
Open from 11 o'clock to 11 o'clock PPQ serves up decent inexpensive Pho. It can be "meat market" busy but the service and foods served will hit the spot.

My friends and I come for a few basic things like the $6.75 shrimp rolls. They are nothing special just very basic with the standard peanut sauce.

At $13.95 their Five Spices Chicken leans on the expensive side of other dishes offered here. It's a boneless quarter chicken marinated, roasted and then fried to serve with steamed Jasmine rice and a bite of salad.

Their Five Spices Chicken Vermicelli is $8.75. I make it a combo and add three shrimp for another $2.25 and this $11.00 dish still falls just a bit short. I then add another $1.50 for a generous bowl of their overly salty chicken broth on the side. 
Many places do this better for less yet these guys are open late so I'm a repeat offender.
author: Caesar A.

description:
I think if I had to eat one food for the rest of my life, it could honestly be pho. It's such a perfectly crafted dish, imbued with cultural significance as rich as its broth. My go to here is the to tai bo vien which is the sliced rare steak with meatballs. The place is usually packed and the staff are usually running around trying to keep up with the endless sea of hungry patrons. 

One thing worth explicitly and specifically mentioning is the five spice chicken which is a standout item here. You can get it spring rolls (favorite), garlic noodles, vermicelli, or even with your pho (comes on the side). I haven't run into it at any other shop I've been to but I'll be damned to find somewhere else that does it better. It's always tender and perfectly cooked with a tinge of sweetness to balance the savory flavor. I'd recommend getting the spring rolls as an introduction to it and letting it speak for itself. 

Now I will stand to say that the broth is not the most stellar one that I've ever had and that Sac does indeed have some places that I'd say stack up better. But that doesn't mean it's not good. It's still rich its in own right and definitely worth eating any day of the week. And with no callousness, I don't think I'd ever choose Sac over SF for anything, much less just for some broth. lol. 

Soup always comes with tons of meat and tons of noodle. You could definitely survive on a small but I always go for the large for a full kick. 

My girlfriend ordered the five spice chicken vermicelli and while I can't ever give up getting soup when I come, there may come a day when I go mad and order both so I can enjoy the amazing flavor of both dishes.

Hot tea is available on request and I think service is fairly decent, given that I've only been there less than a handful of times when it's not packed to the brim with customers.

All in all, PPQ puts in the time and effort and I'd like to see someone to present a better place for pho in the city.
author: Charles M.

description: Came here on a Saturday at 11 AM with my grandpa and friend. It is your typical Vietnamese Restaurant with brown tables, condiments, and sauce dishes, etc on the table.  I ordered the Satay Pho and my friend ordered the Beef Combination Pho. The Satay Pho was quite interesting. Satay Sauce, broth, cucumber slices, tomato, and alot of noodles. I tried my friends broth and it wasn't too shabby. If I were to compare this to Kevin's I would say this place uses less msg and they are more or less pretty much the same place but this place offers CURRY CHICKEN PHO which I have never seen before anywhere else. I will definitely be back to try it out.
author: Brian C.

description: If you are a big fan of Vietnamese pho,here is a place to go,the owner Sam runs this restaurant more 10 years already,the soup base is so rich,every time I eat and drink everything inside the bowl!try their Chicken curry pho,it's my favorite!
author: Siqi C.

description:
It's an ok place to eat especially when all the other Viet restaurants close at 9pm. 
It gets busy because there aren't many Viet options in the Sunset area and when they open until 11pm, it's a go to spot when your sick of eating burgers, pizza and other fast food options. 
The line gets pretty busy at times, so I would dress warm in the winter because there isn't a waiting room.

The best thing about Pho Phu Quoc is the variety. The curry noodle soup is ok but I prefer the Bun bo Hue over the pho.
author: Keith A.

description: I dislike this place especially the coconut curry. There was hair in my coconut curry. It just taste like any basic coconut curry that I could've made at home lol
author: Julia D.

description: I don't care what any of these people on here say about this place it is hands down the best chicken and rice for the price anywhere in the city and imperial rolls. The pho is amazing don't listen to all the bs on here.....
author: Dara M.

description:
If I'm craving Phó I come here.. 
this is my standard go to place. 
Food is always good.
author: Kiel V.

description: I asked for 2 extra bowl and they brought us 2 dirty used bowls. Terrible services.  Will definitely not going back for this restaurant again.
author: Will N.

description:
One of my favorite pho spots in the city. They have all he usual stiff but here are my favorites;
- traditional beef brisket with tendon (not tripe) pho
- oxtail soup with pho noodles
- five spice chicken pho
- imperial rolls

*never tried the crab soup but my friend tells me it's amazing. 

I litteraloy crave this spot and eat here at least once a month if I'm in town
author: Kaveh M.

description:
CHANGE YOUR GLOVES. Servers use the same gloves to serve you your food AND to clean the restaurant. They seem to wear the same gloves throughout the day. I cannot think of a good reason why they would even wear gloves when they serve you in the first place. I usually do not see any other american or asian restaurant follow this practice. 

Food: Their imperial rolls and #17 meatball and brisket pho is pretty good for the price. 
I have to add a lot of sauce to my bowl to make it taste better. Hot tea is very diluted and is pretty much drinking hot water. 

If you can, i advice you to try other pho places before you head to this place. If all else fails and you are hungover, sick, whatever be the case that you may desperately want pho, then yes this place isnt a bad choice.
author: Carleen C.

description:
Overall: Friendly and fast staff with free street parking after 6pm.

Food: We got the five spice chicken rice plate and curry chicken pho, and the chicken had quite a kick. The proportion of chicken to rice was bad and we were left craving more of the chicken. The curry chicken pho was quite large, but a little too rich to drink the soup, really flavorful broth and tender chicken.
author: Jenny Q.

description:
The chicken coconut curry bowl is BOMB.com

Waiting to be seated kinda sucks if it's cold outside and there isn't much space to stand inside.
author: Karina S.

description: They always have fast service, and food comes out pretty quick. Once in awhile food tastes a bit salty but otherwise good and filling
author: Eugene Z.

description:
We got the coconut curry soup and the imperial rolls. I was expecting the soup to have more flavor then it did. It wasn't bad, but Kevin's has my heart. I was really excited to try this soup because I've heard good things :/ 

Their chopsticks and spoons were old and dirty, the service took a while compared to Kevin's.
author: Hayley D.

description: Their pho is very bland. They don't give you much meat. I ordered a BBH to go and they gave me Pho noodles instead of the round vermicelli noodles that come with it. The only good thing about this place is that they open late. I rather go across the street to Kevins Pho for better tasting food.
author: Megan K.

description:
A solid pho place.

It's fairly priced for very large servings--the medium is more like a large and there is no small size, so I recommend you share a bowl if you don't have a large stomach like me.

The pho itself is very good. I got the dac biet, a solid default choice for pho in general. It was very good, and the broth wasn't too salty. I thought it was strange they gave me a lemon wedge instead of lime, but it didn't make too much of a difference to me.

I recommend this place if you're craving some Vietnamese food or want something for cheap!
author: Christine K.

description:
A local favorite pho place - this place is nearly always busy and definitely expect a wait during peak meal times. I went around 9pm and the whole restaurant was still full. You definitely will get what you pay for since a large is bigger than your face. There are great menu selections atypical of pho places, such as curry pho or oxtail pho. I opted for the latter.

Oxtail pho does not come with the normal rice noodles - it must come with egg noodles. I think it complemented the oxtail rather well, as the soft and tender meat is contrasted by the chewy toughness of the egg noodle. I was slightly dissatisfied by its preparation though. The menu description clearly states that potatoes and carrots are stewed together in the bowl. Well guess what? There was ONE carrot and ZERO potatoes.
author: Lily C.

description: Bbq chicken could have been more crispy  but it was good.  Good portion.  Fast and Great service. Clean. Solid place.
author: Helen L.

description: Garlic noodles is one only reason i come here. I'll be back soon, it's so delicious .
author: Imperial F.

description: I like five spice chicken with rice and the pho . Been here service is friendly service is good speaks good English. Prices a good
author: Jeannine P.

description:
Good food, been coming here since i was a kid, used to be my grandma's favorite place. But as the owners have grown in success over the years, the customer service has plummeted.

We were in the middle of our meal when another couple walked in. There were no tables open. The lady working promptly dropped the bill off at our table. Seeing as how we had pretty much just gotten our food, we ignored the bill and kept eating. Five minutes later the lady came back and in a few words, asked us to hurry up and leave, gesturing that the two customers were waiting to be seated. Just because you do it with a smile, doesn't mean it isn't rude. 

They just don't value their customers anymore.
author: Will T.

description:
I came here with friends a few years ago and they were explaining how amazing the Curry Pho was here. Being Vietnamese & being spoiled with the best Vietnamese food in San Jose, I was intrigued to try the Curry Pho since I've never heard of it before.

Let me tell you, this dish is brilliant! If you're a huge fan of spicy coconut soup, then this is the dish for you! I must admit that the dish is a bit heavy from the coconut milk but it won't stop me from finishing the bowl! The portions are huge and definitely enough to share with 2 people. 

I also recommend trying the Imperial Rolls as well! It comes with lettuce on the side, perfect for wrapping the Imperial Rolls in and dipping it in fish sauce.
author: MyTien P.

description:
I wish I could give this place more stars because the food was actually really good. I had the shredded chicken pho. However, the restaurant is not clean or well taken care of. The bathroom was filthy and we even saw a small cockroach on the wall when we were finishing our meal. This was really unfortunate because I thought the food was delicious!

I prefer Kevin's across the street for pho. It is so clean and the food is twice as good.
author: Diane R.

description: I LOVE this pho spot! Literally only come here for their chicken curry pho. It's so unique and the flavor is the best! Every pho spot I go to I always look for something similar to this soup and it's never even a little close. Yes parking is tight but it's SF what do you expect ?? The prices to me are average for pho; I don't mind it at all because this soup in literally the best thing ever ! I never have tried any of their other soups but I'd imagine they are quite good also! I really love the curry soup and I highly recommend it!!! You won't regret it! Typically I never have to wait to be seated expect one time ( I have been here 10+)- worth it !
author: Becka W.

description:
This is a 3.5 star restaurant. Let's start with the look. It's not a clean looking restaurant, but it's always packed. Small parties only and be careful walking to the bathroom because it's slippery.

Now on to the food. Solid! They have a great beef carpaccio that's good to share with a couple others. Their pho is pretty standard for San Francisco, and definitely fulfills any cravings you might have. They also have a curry pho, which has a whole lot of flavor and is worth a try! We sometimes go out of our way to get the food here, so if you have a smaller party (6 at most) then PPQ is probably a better choice than Kevin's across the street. I go to Kevin's when I'm in other areas, but PPQ is the place to go on Irving Street!
author: Aaron Y.

description: Pho is good, but their bun bo hue was basically pho broth with chilli oil on top. Disappointed.
author: Sarah H.

description: I have been coming here for years and have never once had a disappointing meal. They have the best Curry Chicken Vermicelli Noodle Soup that you will ever eat. It will warm you up and you'll leave looking forward to your next visit. Also, if you love fried foods like I do, don't forget to get the Fried Veggie Spring rolls, as they may actually change your life.
author: Sydney G.

description:
I've eaten here a few other times but always got just a regular bowl of beef pho. today, I was persuaded to try their curry pho and OH MY GOSH I don't think I can go back to beef broth pho. #8 spicy curry chicken pho, that's the way to go. their curry broth is so rich in flavor, with the hints of coconut in there, mildly spicy, and generous slices of chicken. I got mine with the round noodles (what they use for bun bo hue). 

come here for their currrrryyyyyyyy
author: Ava F.

description: Great restaurant. One of my favorites in the neighborhood and is consistently good unlike the others in the area.
author: Lynda N.

description: I got the five spice chicken changing the broth to curry. A long time ago when I had the curry broth , I was pretty impressed. After coming back , they curry broth did not wow me. It lack the sweet coconut fragrant/taste. Mostly tasted the hot oil lol . The waiters/ waitress didn't even bring me water... I was ok, whatever. The only redemptive quality was the five spice chicken. It was a bit oily , but the skin was nice and crunchy. The flavor was decent.
author: Joyce C.

description: FYI: this is a Chinese owner. Don't go here! The pho was bland and not good at all. I had family visiting from out of state and made the mistake of taking them here. They were so disappointed with SF pho.
author: Mailena L.

description:
BEST PHO WEST OF VAN NESS - STREET PARKING USUALLY NOT TOO HARD!

Not much needs to be said that hasn't been said already. This place is awesome is you're down to make the trip. Great everything. The pho is awesome, the rolls are awesome, everything is cheap!

Pro Tip- Get the Satay Pho, my favorite thing here - got some nice spice, kicks just right, changes it up. Hit up the Chinese bakeries after for dessert.
author: Roger L.

description:
I like the taste of the food here.
It was good!
I only came here once and my friends told me that it's good.
So i decided to give it a try.
The food is decent.
The glass was dirty.
and the wait is long.
So...you decide.
author: Candice L.

description: My advice for this pho place is keep it simple and you will be happy. I always get the 5 spice chicken pho and have yet to be disappointed. Service is fast and the food is good and hot. Price is very good considering the rest of the options on Irving.
author: Alex H.

description: Although a Vietnamese spot, I wasn't feeling pho for the day. Instead, I ordered the Five Spices Chicken Garlic Noodle ($10.25) and it was the best decision of the day. Trust me, get this! The garlic flavor covered the strands of noodles and were incredibly delicious. Slices of charred chicken topped with green onions were very flavorful and a great addition to the noodles with the fish sauce. It even came with a little salad to complete the meal. I seriously loved the garlic noodles here so much. The only letdown was their slow and rude service, but then again that's almost expected at Asian places.
author: Cindy Z.

description:
Not so good Pho. Meh. Bland broth, not enough natural beef flavor. The owners need to travel to Sacramento and try the Pho at Pho Anh Dao. The most amazing broth in the world exists there. 

Come on SF, step it up wit the Pho game. Kevin's is not good, and this one is not good too. Where do I go for some good pho on the city?
author: Lee S.

description: The food here is always great. We always get an order of imperial rolls because they're always good. The five spice chicken is never a disappointment either. I don't typically go for Pho, but it's really good here. The vermicelli is a nice alternative as well. This has become our standard go to spot when we're craving pho or noodles.
author: Ben M.

description:
Really friendly service. Came here on a Sunday morning and was seated immediately. Got our food quickly and unlike some other pho places in SF, they did not rush us out. 

Ordered the #5- it was okay, but there was something missing. Although I did at first mistakenly think it was going to be spicy and it wasn't at all- so that was a plus because I could add as much siracha as I want. 

I'd come here more so for the friendliness and lack of wait rather than the pho itself.
author: Arezou A.

description:
Went to this Pho place today, as soon as we entered, we heard the lady manager yelling at the workers in the kitchen area.  She looked angrily at us, we seated at the first table nearest to the entrance.  She came a few minutes later with the menus and said "you can't sit here, this place will be fill up shortly with more customers"... she then threw the menus onto a table a few roll back toward the kitchen and demanded that we must sit there.
We got up and Left this depressing place to refused to deals with the owner negative energy and poor customer services skill.

We walk across the street to Pho Huynh Hiep and was immediately greeted with hot tea and fast services.  The quality of Pho here is almost as good as our mom.  We left satisfied and vow never go back to Pho Phu Quoc PPQ beef noodle again.

Don't come here unless you wanted to be treated badly.  It reminded us of a "Soup Naziz"  in one of Seinfel's TV show.
author: Truc P.

description: I'm no expert on Pho, and can't speak to authenticity, but what I can speak to is how good the food was! I had the Spicy Beef Pho (#5), and a Thai Iced Tea which were both delicious. The spiciness of the pho was a little light, but it still cleared my sinuses! The service was a little gruff, but the food came out crazy fast - within just a few minutes of me ordering. The portion sizes are massive, so large that even though I ordered the "medium" protion, I had to take half of it home with me. Will definitely recommend to my friends!
author: Jordan F.

description: This place is always my favorite Vietnamese restaurant. I love the five spice chicken and their curry chicken with flat noodle. Their chicken cook perfectly and the soup base taste good. It never disappointed me.
author: angel w.

description:
Came to PPQ on a weekday night, plenty of tables and no wait. Staff was friendly and service was fast. 

I ordered a number 1 house pho medium size, which comes in a generous portion. The soup base is flavorful and not too salty, but could be bolder. There are a variety of meat and beef balls, and the tendons were very tender. Definitely an above average Vietnamese restaurant. 

Although conveniently located on Irving St, it is difficult to find parking around this area. Will come back to try the other items when around the area and craving Vietnamese food!
author: Karen C.

description:
My go to pho spot and should be your go to pho spot. Has been around for years since I was a kid and was my family's favorite pho place in the area. Parking isn't the best but that's the entirety of Irving St for you! 

Have tried the assortment of pho, rice plates, and curry plates. All are good options but pho is the best in my opinion.
author: Carissa G.

description: DOn't get the lukewarm spring rolls w/lettuce in it. I'm pretty positive those rolls gave me food poisoning on 12/29/17. I had them at 5:30p and started feeling sick at 11p and puking by midnight. It was horrible. it might even be related to the e.coli outbreak the same time period. I usually never order lettuce in any food but was saving my stomach for a formal dinner later that night with my friend. ugh, totally regret that. I was a mess for 2 whole days. Then my stomach was on and off for 3 more days. My hubs and son were fine bc they just ate the hot pho. ugh my bad. I
author: Emm C.

description: Honestly,  I once thought this place was a hidden gem and oh boy i was so wrong about that. I would not recommend the rice dishes at this place because it was beyond underwhelming. Words can't describe on how pathetic the dish was due to the lack of ingredients on the dish. It was basically rice and thats it... Where was the flavor... Where was the customer service... Where was anything.. Oh boy..... This was one of the worse experience i had and i just wanted to have a good meal after work... Do not come here.
author: Henry T.

description: Love this place. Some what pricey for a broke college student but I come here when I want to treat myself. I've gotten the rare steak pho and the 5 spice chicken plate from here and both have been so delicious every time. they're often busy with calls and tables but other than that the service is decent. Worth the wait sometimes!
author: Ashley D.

description: I feel there has always been a rivalry between here and Kevin's across the street growing up in this area. I don't come to PPQ as often, but their pho here is pretty good. I've tried their bun bo hue a long time ago and had their special beef pho multiple times. My sister and I have always failed to get ahold of their bun rieu (do they just make a few a day?), so hopefully one day we'll try it. The space here is a bit more run down, but PPQ is great for a "late night" (in SF terms because they close at 11pm) pho fix since most Vietnamese restaurants in this area close around 9pm. If you aren't feeling pho, they do have rice plates and vermicelli bowls as other options. I have some friends who love their imperial rolls here, which in my opinion I think are okay.
author: Kathleen S.

description: Whenever I'm in the area I always like to come here for their rice dishes.  The beef and chicken are grilled to perfection and you always expect the great quality that they have.  The prices are really reasonable and you can walk out of their paying less than $10 for dinner or lunch.   I also like their curry noodles as we'll because they actually fry their potatoes in the curry sauce and it adds that special touch.  Imperial rolls are very nice here as well.
author: Loi T.

description:
Not exactly the great place but it opens till 11 PM which is a plus.

I have not been to this location in a long time because the noodles were rockhard and cold at my previous visit... In other words, serve straight from the fridge. 

The portions and prices are definitely higher than the other restaurant across the street. If you have a huge appetite then I would recommend this restaurant
author: Danae L.

description:
One of my favorite pho places. I always order #8 curry broth with brisket (sometimes I sub five spice chicken) and wide rice noodles. They're always quick to bring your food out. 

Minus one star for 85 health rating. They can step it up in this capacity. 

Also friendly tip. It's open till 11pm.
author: Christopher S.

description:
Brought here by a local friend who swears by the food here.

I definitely enjoyed it... but I wouldn't say it's in my Top Five Vietnamese places.

A solid choice, but maybe not the gold, silver, or bronze medal, to me anyway.
author: Sean B.

description: One of the best kept secrets I wish I knew about way earlier: get the five spice chicken and noodles with curry broth, not pho broth. It's not one of the actual dishes on the menu but they allow these sorts of changes if you ask.
author: Christopher W.

description:
Another delicious hole in the wall restaurant that has certainly become a local favorite! My baby sister and her friends love coming here for the delicious curry chicken with pho noodles or fat noodles and I must say, I agree myself!

Upon walking in, it is a small restaurant hat probably seats about 40 people max, the restaurant is clean and the staff are nice. You can tell not a lot of people work there as a lot of different people assist with each order (your server is different from the person who brought you water or took your order or delivers your food), totally don't mind it because everyone helps each other out.

My baby sister got the bun with egg rolls and chicken I think, her friends got the curry chicken pho noodles and I got the satay beef pho noodles and all of them were amazing! We also got an appetizer of the beef capachio (I think I spelled it wrong) but it is very similar to a ceviche! The meat was rare with red onions, lemons, green onions, a sauce, and loads of peanuts! Very fresh and very delicious!! The meat tasted amazing and melted in your mouth like butter!

The chicken curry was delicious as well, it had a nice wonderful coconut sweet and savory flavor and the chicken was cooked perfectly- it tastes like the chicken was marinated in the curry sauce! The bun with egg rolls was delicious too, you can tell the noodles were fresh and the egg rolls were freshly made because it had a nice crispy crunch to it! My beef satay noodles were just as delicious, the sauce was made with their signature PPQ sauce and it was not greasy at all! With each meal, they put a bunch of noodles and meat in each bowl! The beef satay pho bowl was a nice soupy meal for a cold day as the curry chicken bowls were too! If you're thinking the beef satay bowl as similar to bun bo hue, it's not- this one has more of a peanut- chili base as bun bo hur has more of a lemongrass base. Each bowl was about 8.00 or 9.00 but oh so worth it! 

All in all, I am so glad my sister recommend to eat this place! Definitely coming back here for sure!
author: Rosie T.

description:
I've been coming here for 10 years not realizing that they DON'T clean their plates. I had one of their soups and later found a little friend in there. Not only that but they have THE RUDEST cashier. When placing an order today, they hung up on me twice on a fairly simple order. Food is good but not worth the food poisoning or the subpar customer service. No matter how cheap it may be, invest your money somewhere else. Should have been shut down way long ago.

Update:
They dont understand English very well so instead of being patient they just hang up on you.
author: Dianne A.

description: Never actually ate here. We walked in the saw an empty table and wanted the get seated. The old man at the counter barked at us and stared as us angrily and point towards the door. We though he meant we needed to wait so we waited by the door. But others came in and just got seated so we didn't really understand what was going on. After about 10 minutes of waiting, and none of the waiters wanting to even talk with us we just left.
author: Jia Jian T.

description:
I remember a friend telling me that I shouldn't eat at PPQ because they don't clean their dishes. I brushed it off thinking, "a lot of Asian places don't do a great job of  cleaning so it should be fine." 
I went with a friend and we both ended up getting food poisoning. I threw up twice so far. I should've listened to my friend.
author: Tracy H.

description: Pho noodle beef soup was delicious. Fast and friendly customer service. Good for kids.
author: Mila N.

description: Came for the curry pho and it was pretty good.  It tasted like Tom Kha with pho noodles. Needed to add a little bit of salt and lime and it was a solid 3 stars.  We substituted the breast chicken with the 5-spice chicken and OMG so good. The chicken alone was a 5.  It was worth the 80 cents surcharge.  We also ordered the imperial rolls and these was fantastic.  Had we just ordered the 5-spice chicken and imperial rolls, this place would easily be 5 stars. I would come back again and try other things and perhaps change my review. In the meantime, 3 stars will do.
author: Jaylin C.

description:
Ordered the ox tail stew rice plate but was a little disappointed as the stew was on the soupy side.   I'm sure this would compliment the pho better in this state - was just expecting more thickness in the sauce.
Will try something else next time.
author: Drew B.

description: Yes please and thank you. Their pho is my hangover got to. The Bun no Hue is good too.
author: Mel M.

description: TBH if it was up to me I wouldn't even give them a star. The lady working in there right now was rude as hell! And you guys might wanna change your opening time, because yelp says 11am & it's 12:23pm & the restaurant still isn't open! And you guys also might wanna think about hiring new staff! Just a thought
author: Maria P.

description:
Pho is average but people and the workers act like its the best in the bay area. Pho subpar, have fun with the crowds, and the service is horrible. 

When it first opened it was okay, now it is not good whatsoever.

Try going to pho the gioi at westborough.
author: Raymond F.

description:
If you love anything fried, then you will fall in love with PPQs Imperial Rolls! They're stuffed with vermicelli noodles, shredded carrots, and pork, and are deep-fried to a crisp perfection. Once you dip 'em into that fish sauce and take a bite, you'll be smitten too! 

PPQ is my go-to spot for pho in the Sunset. I've been here at least a dozen times and they consistently turn out delicious and inexpensive noodle bowls that keep me coming back. Most people order #1-3, which are the beef noodle pho bowls with brisket, tendon, tripe, beef balls, etc. The Spicy Chicken Curry Pho is another solid pick and one that I overlooked for awhile. Once I tried it though, it became a common order! The broth has a mild curry flavor that is slightly creamy it really does pack a lot of heat, so if you're a lightweight, beware! Still can't decide? The beef stew bowl is a good choice too! 

If you want to splurge or are feeling adventurous, try the Beef Carpaccio. It's fresh, tangy, and delicious! Just beware of the peanuts they throw on top if you're allergic.

Not the greatest service because they're always pretty packed, but they're good about acknowledging you when you flag them down. It's also standard for them not to clear your dishes until you're finished with your meal, so just push those empty plates aside and chow down!
author: Deanna Y.

description:
My friend was craving Pho so we decided to stop by here for a late lunch.  I'm Vietnamese from San Jose, so I've had my fair share of pho.

I decided to opt for the #1 Combination Pho bowl (size medium).  My friends got some oxtail stew, garlic noodles with chicken, and pho with rare steak and meatballs.

I requested some onions with vinegar in Vietnamese and the server had a stumped face (I wanted to test out how Vietnamese this place was...the answer is not so much).

So I asked for it in English and he still looked a bit confused.  Later on he brought me a small sauce sized portion of raw onions and a bottle of white vinegar.  I guess they don't have that much request for this in SF...

The bowls were a good size. My broth was pretty good.  Then I commenced to put a crap ton of siracha and hoisan sauce as I always do.  And almost a whole lemon (they didn't have lime).  

They had enough noodles, but the real bummer was their meat portion was beyond skimpy.  I mean, I think I had ONE small piece of rare steak in my bowl.  Seriously?!  My other friend who also ordered the pho concurred that they were very cheap with their meat portion.

I tried some of the garlic noodles...it was pretty standard.  Not really greasy so that's good.  The oxtail stew was just ok as well.

All in all, I was disappointed with their portions.
author: Kim D.

description: The curry chicken vermacelli pho was phenomenal!!!! So flavorful! The imperial rolls are bomb! Wonderful portions! Great atmosphere  I would eat here again!
author: Shenaye L.

description:
This was definitely a go-to Pho place while in college for plenty of reasons!

1. Price- definitely affordable on a college student budget! AND! You get more than what you paid for! Depending on the size you get, it's about $8-$9.

2. Quality- SO WORTH IT! They're pretty consistent with taste. You won't be disappointed!

3. Service- seated pretty quickly so you can grub & bounce in between classes! TIP: bring cash for faster service. BUT! Parking is difficult. So take that into account.

4. Food- SO YUMMY! My favorite was #1, that was my always go to. Then I found #8. The curry chicken pho, omg. MMMMMM. Get it. You will be in HEAVEN!!!

I love this place & I definitely miss it a lot. You don't find a lot of Pho places that offer curry chicken pho. That alone always makes me want to come back for more.
author: Gwyne P.

description:
This is actually one of my favorite pho places in the city. I've had all kinds of dishes from here, but I gravitate towards their imperial rolls and spicy noodle soup.

*Hue spicy noodle soup http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/pho-phu-quoc-ppq-beef-noodle-house-restaurant-san-francisco#QTG6IGsdKjhblIetdvK28A
*Sides for Hue spicy noodle soup http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/pho-phu-quoc-ppq-beef-noodle-house-restaurant-san-francisco?select=UIqRYHQXMb0wLxCasEO4oA#0sB5n2L3O_7vwvYKGgMyQg
*Imperial rolls http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/pho-phu-quoc-ppq-beef-noodle-house-restaurant-san-francisco?select=UIqRYHQXMb0wLxCasEO4oA#UIqRYHQXMb0wLxCasEO4oA

It can get crowded at times and parking can be awful in this area, but I think it's worth the patience. Their noodle soups are that good. Full of flavor and very comforting. When I'm craving soup, I know PPQ will hit the spot.
author: Elena N.

description:
The bf and I went to this restaurant after much debate since there is a similar Vietnamese restaurant directly across from it. I was told that the curry pho is delicious in addition to the Five Spice Chicken, so we went.

He wanted the #1 pho on the menu and said it was his favorite, while I ordered the Five Spice Chicken with Rice and a Taro Milk Tea.

Let me start with the Milk Tea. It was delicious! It came with real Taro (not powder) and little tapioca in the drink! I wished the straw they gave were bigger but it made us take our time with the drink and not down it all at once.

The Pho was quite good, but perhaps because we took the food to-go, it wasn't as good as it should have been. It was probably not as hot by the time we got around to eating it.

The chicken though, was well marinated, but not too salty or sweet. And then it came with this mildly spicy vinegar sauce that went very well with it. Remember not to put too much though!

Overall this was a great Pho place and even though Pho is not my go-to dinner place, I would absolutely eat at this place again no question asked! :) Even if I wasn't feeling like eating Pho that day.
author: Kimberly W.

description:
