When you ride BART 5-6 times a week and with our current El Nino system, you're bound to get sick sooner than later. I someone managed to roll out of bed and make it to work and once lunch time came around, my co-worker suggested pho to bring me back to life. I'm never to turn down pho and was hoping some broth would be exactly what I needed. We hopped in the work truck and me our way to the Sunset.

As we made our way into Pho Phu Quoc, my first impression was that it was small but bustling, which is always a good sign. Fortunately, we lucked out and as we entered we were quickly seated towards the back. The extensive menu has plenty to choose from but I typically always order a chicken pho. I settled on #9, the shredded chicken noodle soup ($8.50), which is hand pulled chicken in chicken broth with flat noodles. 

In addition to the pho, I also shared the Five Spice Chicken Rolls appetizer with my co-worker. The rolls run for $6.95 and are soft rice paper rolls with their five spice chicken, lettuce, mint leaves and vermicelli noodles. With our order in, we sipped on hot tea as we waited for the appetizer to come out. Less than 10 minutes later, the chicken rolls were served and we devoured them before I could even get a shot of them. An order comes with three rolls, sliced into six pieces. 

Moments after I took my last bite, the pho came out and I was pleased with my choice to get a medium bowl as the large would of been too much even for me. The pho was steaming hot and was exactly what I needed with my running nose and headache. The chicken was tender, the broth was flavorful without being greasy, and the noodles were plentiful. I did like the combination of flavors but it needed heat and Sriracha was the only hot sauce provided, unfortunately. 

Overall, I was pleased with the pho at Pho Phu Quoc but it wasn't as flavorful or delicious as I would of hoped. In the city of San Francisco, you have more than your fair share of options and although PPQ is passable, it doesn't have me rushing to come back. I will say that service was great and the Five Spice Chicken Rolls were a must have, and perhaps next time I'll order the Five Spice Chicken pho. 

Ambiance/Decor: 1/5
Food: 3/5 
Service: 3/5
Price: $$
Overall: 3/5

Pros:
+ Large selection of pho broths
+ Delicious Five Spice Chicken Roll appetizer
+ Reasonably priced 
+ Quick service 
+ Credit cards accepted

Cons:
- Not the most flavorful pho (#9)
- Only hot sauce is Sriracha
author: Alexander E.

description:
Good pho, great for rainy and cold days. A little slow on the service but it definitely satisfied by pho craving. Portions seemed smaller than I remembered too.

On a rainy Thursday afternoon, almost all the tables were full, but I was still seated immediately. Maybe that was why the service was on the slow side. 

The medium five spiced chicken pho ($8.50) is my go-to thing to order here! The noodles come in a little clump in a bowl of beef broth. Even though I usually cannot finish the entire thing, I had no problem today... Either I was super hungry or they reduced their portion size... However, today the five spiced chicken arrived quite a while after my noodles. The five spiced chicken was a little oily and one of them had some bones in it. Be careful not to choke if you order this! x.x

After I gave my credit card to pay, the server also took a while to return my card... Overall, solid food if not a bit on the small side and slow service. This is still my go-to pho place!
author: Grace C.

description:
FIVE SPICE CHICKEN IS SO GOOD. Planning to come back soon to get just the chicken. 

I just wish that the portions were a bit bigger and that the service was a bit friendlier. While our food came out lightning fast, there was no sense of hospitality. Also wish the restaurant itself was cleaner; the bathroom was really dirty ;(
author: Samantha C.

description:
The food was good.

The waitress never came back with my change and so my party and I sat there for an extra 30 minutes and the owner thought we never paid. Thanks lady for making me look like I was going to dine and dash.
author: Char M.

description: Good, cheap noodles and efficient service. Immediately after the ending of Hardly Strictly Bluegrass they were slammed but maintained their speed, quality and service. I was quite impressed. Now I wouldn't say I'd cross the bay for the food but I have no hesitation in recommending it or eating there again.
author: Mike D.

description: Came here for dinner on a cold rainy night. I would say 2.5-3 stars. Honestly the food was nothing to rave about. My friend ordered the satay pho, the broth was good but nothing exciting. I ordered the broken rice plate with beef. Portion wise, it's standard for SF pricing. However, I felt as though the beef tasted more like teriyaki beef than grilled vietnamese beef. I was not too satisfied with the flavors of the meat and was hoping for more of a kick. I would go across the street for my vietnamese fix.
author: Diane T.

description:
Currently, this spot is my go to pho place with friends. The wait varies but whenever we go, there isn't a line. I believe after 5:30PM it might get a little crazy because families try to have dinner together. When I am seated, I always tend to go for the beef pho with thick noodles. I remember this lady told me that youngsters like the thin noodles while older folks like thicker ones. It went something like that and I ended up getting thicker! Does that make me old?

ANYWAYS; when it comes down to the wire..
-Loads of salt 
-Definitely affordable
-Brings the food asap and refills your water
-Parking's kind of hard to find because its Irving!
author: Liza H.

description: Pretty good pho place. It's one of the few Vietnamese restaurants that offers the Bun Rieu soup, so I like to go here for that. But I felt it was a bit salty and too oily. The five spice chicken with garlic noodle is pretty good.
author: Rose L.

description: One of my favorite Vietnamese places, maybe in my top 10 or 5. I love this place, such good quality food. Sometimes a bit of a line outside, but worth it. Their specialty is the pho with the rare beef, which is almost like Kobe beef served separately on a side dish to add in the scolding pho which cooks it at the last second. Very good. They have a great bun rieu (tomato crab vermicelli soup) and an amazing papaya salad! But the 5 spice chicken over garlic noodles is outstanding. It's a toss up for that dish as being the best at either Ben Tre or here. Either way, this place is probably the best Vietnamese restaurant in San Francisco.
author: Peter K.

description:
I finally got to try the much talked about PPQ last Saturday.  My friend and I finished our hike at Land's End and got to PPQ around 11:30ish and got lucky with parking.  To our surprise there were only a couple tables left.  Tables here are pretty cramped closed together.  I wasn't too much in the mood for pho so I went with the Five Spice Chicken Egg Noodle soup (medium for under $8).  She got the #1 pho with all the goodies.  

I was surprised at how busy this place gets, I mean a pho place with a waiting list is pretty rare.  Finally our soups were served.  Liked how they kept the five spice chicken separate.  The skin could have been crispier and a little less greasy, but it was still pretty satisfying.  The egg noodles were plentiful and cooked perfectly.  The soup wasn't greasy and was flavorful, but a little too herby (star anise?) for me.  As others have mentioned, it is a little pricier than most pho restaurants, but at least the broth is flavorful!  I had a piece of my friend's beef from her pho.  Theirs is cut into strips instead of the rounds.  

I can see why it's popular, but I don't think I would go out of my way for a bowl of pho or noodle soup here.  Maybe if I was really craving it though.  Service is a little slow here as I saw a nearby table try to flag the waitress several times at the end of their meal.  3 stars for now.
author: Cat C.

description:
We came here on a Sunday evening, and the restaurant was full. But, even though we were 5, we got a table in a matter of minutes.

I went to the restroom, which is a super big room (for a restroom), with a toilet, a sink, the hand dryer, and all the cleaning supplies of the restaurant. Kind of weird, but ok.

We ordered water and our food. I tried their #1, which is a Pho with beef stock and lots of meat. To my displeasure, the noodles were basically clumped up in a ball submerged in the broth. That's a no-no. Also, #1 comes with a lot of weird meat (like tripe). The broth wasn't anything amazing. 

But, what I disliked the most was the service. Definitely not the worst, but it was not good either. They brought our water after a few reminders, and it was quite hard to get the waiter's attention, even when we wanted to order the bill.

I did like this shrimp appetizer that they have. Super tasty. But I was expecting for the Pho to be the star in a Pho restaurant. Maybe it was an odd day for them and they are usually better. But I'm not willing to come back to figure it out. For sure, I have experienced better.
author: Andréia S.

description: Quality of food is decent , but i honestly have had better .  Service is horrible , speaking viet to the waitress and she cant even understand me but yet she is vietnamese ??
author: Timothy V.

description:
GOOD place to get a bowl of pho on a cold night! 

This is a very typical Vietnamese restaurant with very typical pho. My friends and I came here on a Sunday night. There was a lot of people but also there were many seating, so we were seated immediately.

I ordered a large bowl of curry  chicken pho ($10). It was very nice - the noodles were thin and the curry soup was creamy. The chicken was not finely chopped though, and just came out as huge lumps of meat. It was definitely a LARGE order. I could have eaten it for two serving, since the noodle soaked up the soup. 

Taste-wise, it was good. But I am not sure how authentic it would be. I would go there to fill my stomach. Maybe not to really enjoy the food. Overall, it is just an average experience.
author: Wendy F.

description: If you are looking for an authentic Pho experience, I would highly recommend this place. The service is fast and the food is delicious!
author: Brittney G.

description:
Probably one of the worst pho dining experiences ever in SF...too bad cause I had heard decent reviews. 

The pho broth had zero flavor as if the stock came from can of beef broth.  The service was cheap on the condiments i.e. herbs, bean sprouts, etc. 

Won't be coming back.
author: Mark T.

description:
The crab soup is the best. For the other dishes, it's OK.. Not to die for
But you might die if you take the imperial rolls. Nasty and greasy like holl
Service is very slow.
author: Jean-Yves F.

description:
I give it a solid 3 1/2 stars. It's my favorite Pho noodle house in SF. Been coming here for a long time also. I don't know if it's just my imagination or the food quality and taste is not quite as good as it once was. 

Today I ordered #32 grilled beef Bun. I swear they used to put a good amount of beef in the bowl. But not today. There were lots of noodle and veggies. I like their grilled meat and I wish there were more of it. But not today. 

I also had some of my wife beef Pho. No complain there. It's as good as always. 

The price is reasonable I guess. Most food in the city isn't cheap. And if it's cheap then it's generally isn't good. PPQ is in the middle of the road as far as the price for a noodle house. 

I would rate them higher but they could use some help as far as cleanliness. My wife and I once saw a roach crawling up their wall while we were eating our food. It was quite a turnoff. I didn't make a big deal. Figured is part of the Asian food scene in the city.  
It is what it is. I'm sure it's worst in some other place. 

Service is hit or miss but isn't a big deal. I never expect much going into these kind of restaurants.
author: Tawan G.

description:
How can you not like PPQ? This is my go-to place for pho when it is raining and cold. I typically get the chicken pho in a medium and its delicious. It is with the thicker white noodles than your typically noodles but I'm okay with that. Warning for those who get a large: it is even MORE noodles so unless you need carbs a medium should be enough. Their imperial rolls are awesome and my other choice would be the five spice chicken pho because you get it on the side and its nice and crispy. I love the broth because it is light enough to drink but it has great flavor to it.

Only downside is that it does get crowded and people are ridiculous and decide they need all 10 of their friends with them to eat pho and take up way too much space. If you end up right next to the door like us you'll see peoples butts right next to your food and people talking and chewing gum as well.
author: Angela S.

description:
5 Stars for what they do better than anyone-
Their 5 spice chicken 
Simply fantastic and consistently delicious
author: james m.

description: There pho is ok. We've been to other places that has better pho. One thing I dont like about this place is there customer service. These guys are so rude, especially the guys standing at the register.
author: PremiumShotz P.

description:
The PPQ family (PPQ Noodle House on Irving St and PPQ Dungeness Island on Clement St) have established themselves in two of the most Asian neighborhoods in SF. I tried PPQ Dungeness Island not too long ago and was unimpressed with their crab family-style dinner. And sorry to say, but I wasn't as pleased with their Noodle House branch either.

The five spice chicken noodle soup was decent overall. The dark meat chicken was really flavorful, with moist and juicy meat and a well-seasoned, crispy skin. However, the accompanying beef broth with pho was tasteless. It was extremely bland and needed loads of sriracha and hoisin sauce for added flavor. Many rave about PPQ's curry chicken vermicelli noodle soup, so I may give that a try next time if I were to revisit.

I'm sure there's a playful war between PPQ and Kevin's, with regulars constantly arguing which of the two is far more superior. But in the end, I side with Kevin's, as they're far cheaper and have much quicker service. PPQ will receive a second visit from me only if it's past 10pm (as Kevin's closes then).
author: Priscilla W.

description:
4 stars only for their curry chicken noodle soup. (I substitue my chicken for 5 spice chicken) you can order #7 with their curry soup, or #8 with 5 spice chicken instead.

Honestly, I've never gotten anything else, so I can only review them on this one dish.

The curry broth isn't too thick (I hate it when curry soups are too thick and you're left with soggy gooey noodles). The curry flavor isn't too strong either. Make sure you add some lime juice to enhance the coconut and curry flavors. So good. Their 5 spice chicken is always flavorful, tender and juicy.

I don't recommend coming here with large groups, the wait can get long and they're seating arrangement doesn't accommodate well for large groups (4 or less)

Expect a wait. Usually not that long about 15-30 min wait. Make sure you put your name on the clipboard.

Service is fast and very typical of a pho restaurant. They turn over tables pretty fast.

Therefore it's an eat and leave type of joint, don't expect to hang out and chit chat over a delicious bowl of curry chicken noodles. It's soo good you're too concentrated on devouring it anyways.

Average price ~$8 a bowl (M) or a dollar more for large. They take cards too surprisingly.

I always come here when I'm craving some curry noodle soup. 

I honestly should try some of their other dishes....if I do..I will update.
author: Stephanie L.

description: I've had Pho maybe five times, but this was by far the best I've ever tried!! Both the noodles and veggies were fresh and the broth was awesome too. It's just a little hole-in-the-wall place, but I am so glad I was taken here. It wasn't too busy when we arrived, but by the time we left it was pretty packed, which makes sense because I was told this is one of the best places in SF to get Pho. Service was friendly and quick too, which is a plus. Can't wait to bring the hubby!
author: Steph L.

description: Did a solo trip to San Francisco and my friends advised me to stop at pho pho quoc. The food is alright would eat there again?
author: Justin M.

description:
Nice place for Pho in sunset district. Prices were decent!

*Friendly servers
author: Wendy L.

description:
Pho is fantastic. Broth is amazing. Make sure to let basil soak for a few minutes. Flank steak pho and veggie pho are my favs. For flank steak get the steak rare on the side and cook it yourself in your soup, that way it won't be too well done.
Would be 5 stars if they would get better lighting and maybe some music! The ambiance sucks! Way too bright. 
Still love this place for the bomb pho!
author: Jena L.

description:
Pho real tho, PPQ is the OG pho place on Irving.

You should pho sure try their Curry Pho. They infused the taste of coconut in their broth for your eating pleasure. Mildly spicy and fiercely delicious. Make sure you sub in their chewy dewy pho noodles!

Or try the Satay Pho. This one is Spice Girls spicy and it might just Spice Up Your Life. But if you can handle it, I guarantee you it's Fergie PHOgalicious :)

But nothing's perfect. PPQ is one of the more expensive Vietnamese place on Irving at close to $9 a bowl. Kevin's is slightly cheaper, and don't PHOget, Loi's is only $5.
author: Ringo M.

description:
CURRY CHICKEN VERMICELLI NOODLE SOUP....IS...A....MUST...TRY!!!!

Super unconventional, but that's what makes this one dish, in my humble opinion, one of the best dishes I've ever had, and a dish that I go back to day after day.

The curry is super creamy, the chicken is super tender, the vermicelli is super perfect with the soup, the potatoes (like two or three...) is really good, tastes like french fries.

Again, A MUST TRY.

As for the rest of their food, to me, does not really stand out at all compared to other vietnamese restaurants.

Did I mention their Curry Chicken Vermicelli is a must try?
author: Benjamin W.

description:
I've always seen this pho place but i always went across the street to the other one but now i understand why this one is better. I got the pho ga and i was surprised that it was pretty decent. Came around 130pm and surprisingly there were quite a few people there.

Pho ga: 3.5/5: Very similar to Turtle tower. Theres a decent amount of chicken in here, there are some pieces of dark meat  and some white meat. The broth was simple and satisfying. it had a decent chicken flavor and it had the same wide noodles as turtle tower. While this was decent the broth wasn't as good as turtle towers. I would come here if i am close by!

Tried a piece of  my friends 5 spice chicken and it was delicious, I will definitely want to try that next time! 

Total for pho: $10
author: Stella J.

description: My favorite local Pho restaurant. Always busy but fast and good service . Highly recommended !!
author: payam b.

description: Wow! the best Pho I've ever had. Staff was very nice.
author: Melissa S.

description:
The servers are a team!, and are friendly.  

It's worth the wait in line because the food is delicious! 

Complementary hot tea is served with your order.

 I came here with some friends and our wait for 3 was about 20 minutes.  When we sat down a patient server arrived at our table with hot tea and gave us time while we decided.  Most places make you feel rushed, but there was something about this server and this place that sang "Zen".

For starters we had the Mango Steak Salad , the seasoned chicken spring rolls and veggie spring rolls.  All were polished off in no time because all of these items were delicious.  

Second we split he garlic steak noodles and those were savory and so good! 

Overall I really like this place and will be back soon.  Keep up the good vibes.  :)
author: Justin G.

description: This is my first time here at Pho Phi Quoc. Coming here after 9 pm on Friday night you will have to wait a little to be seated. This place is cool hit beers and drink with desert for your liking. Overall good place to eat pho and dinner plate for your family. I like how that they open till 10:45 pm. Great place but no so great driving around looking for parking.
author: Peter P.

description:
I call myself a pho lover, I used to be eat pho once a week, and this is the place I would go when I need my pho. I always order pho tai with five spice chicken on the side. It officially became my comfort food. I tried their spring rolls (good), papaya salads (good) and beef carpaccio (!!good!!) and they were all very delicious. I also tried their coconut curry noodle thing and garlic noodle, they were good but I came back a few days later to eat pho. I just love their pho! 

They open until late and always packed with people. It seems like people complain about the service, but the waitresses and waiters are friendly and helpful enough. But not so much the lady owner. I saw her yelling at them once and usually has very sour face. But it doesn't really bother me because I'm there to eat pho not to critique. I'm happy that they are close to my home, open late to serve a nice, warm bowl of pho. :)
author: Nana K.

description: Some friends suggested this place and we love it. The 5-spice chicken pho is perfect after a surf session at OB!
author: Caleb K.

description: Ordered shredded chicken noodle soup and was disappointed by the number of pieces of shredded chicken I counted. It should have cost $5 for noodles, broth, and a little bit of chicken. They should dump a lot of shredded chicken for $8. That would make me satisfied. Don't be cheap with your chicken..going to Kevin's across the street next time.
author: Denise C.

description:
I've been to this places many of times to probably try about everything... lol.  Not the best pho as in broth, but the meat quality here is awesome!  They also do not skimp out on the noodles either.  But yes, I wouldn't say it's the best pho, but my go-to for that high quality meat.  Trust, it was not love at first sight, I took time to appreciate this delicious meat compared to all the other joints on Irving.  And yes, I've been to many, like too many.  Anyway, I usually go for number 1, which has everything in it.  I sometimes opt for the bowl with no beef ball because they taste kind of funny to me.  It doesn't have the elasticity of other beef balls I tried.  Or maybe I'm picky.

Imperial Rolls - I always order this as an appetizer.  Love their imperial rolls here.  Always crunchy, crisp and a delight to eat.  I usually wrap it with a piece of lettuce, cucumber and a mint leaf and proceed to dipping it in the yummy fish sauce.  10/10 would recommend these rolls!

Beef Carpaccio - tried it once, but fell in love!!! Raw slices of thin beef ribeye meat topped with lime, peanuts, fish sauce and green onions!!!  Didn't think it would taste that good, but the quality of their meat is great and super fresh.

Vermecelli noodles -  I liked it very much when I got bbq prok with eggrolls, but this is the dish they did skimp noodles and meat.  I wasn't that full after my meal =/   The quality of everything in the bowl is great, but just wasn't so filling.

Porkchops over rice - Meaty portions of porkchops over rice.  Tasted delicious and not too much fat on the porkchops.

Bun bo hue - ehhh... Could be better, not the go-to for BBH.  But I did try some of my friends' soup noodles of curry chicken and the satay beef noodle soup.  Totally a good hearty soup noodle dish if you're trying something different and trying to get your appetite up!  Fresh slices of chicken breast in the curry noodles, so you can't go wrong.
author: Josie L.

description: Cleanest pho restaurant on Irving street. They also have more variety for options since they have curry pho and five spice chicken with garlic noodles. 5/5
author: Victoria T.

description: Kinda sucks that we have to wait long for our food. Two tables behind us already got food. They may make mistake of the orders or what..
author: Becca B.

description: The quality of PPQ's food has gone down over the years. They don't take much pride in their food or service and are really in it for the profit. Their service is horrendous, wether you are dining in or ordering take out. When they are busy, they rush your dining experience. The last time that i dined at PPQ was due to Kevin's being closed and i wanted something warm to fight a cold. The only things that make PPQ a place to visit is their curry noodles and 5 spice chicken soup. Once in a while my boyfriend will crave them and drag me with him to dine there.
author: Lily S.

description:
I want to give a 3 stars because of what happen, but I been here sooo many times, it's always good! ALWAYS! 
What happen wassss, my friend and I came in STARVING! There was ONE empty table but it fit for 4 ppl, and the ONLY table that was for 2 is LITERALLY RIGHT NEXT TO THE DOOR! So I guess we sat there. Ordered our food and started eating, then. .  a marker drops in my bowl. .  (marker was from the clipboard that ppl write their names on), of course my dish was replaced with a new one. 
Anyways, the food is always good as I mentioned, my chicken is soooooo flavorable and tender. I even ate my friends pho and soup, service isn't great but they're attentive when needed, place is small-ish but it holds a good amount. I'll be coming back later and next time, NO MORE SITTING BY THE DOOR.
author: Fiona B.

description:
Happened upon PPQ during a weekend pilgrimage to TPumps (what else do I do with my weekends, really). The Vietnamese restaurant across the street had too long of a line, so we happened upon PPQ. 

We were seated pretty quickly and got to ordering. The restaurant seating was a bit cramped and service was a bit spotty - sometimes staff was very attentive and other times they looked pretty confused coming out of the kitchen. 

But at the end of the day, all I care about is the food. And boy, was the food delicious. I ordered the #1 Pho, and it was incredibly satisfying. The broth had the deep, savory flavors I look for in noodle soup, and the variety of proteins in the soup melded together perfectly. Noodles were al dente without being too soft. Overall, it was a very balanced, delicious, and satisfying bowl of noodle soup, something that I am constantly on the search for.
author: Olivia T.

description: Pho do khung khiep! Khong mui khong vi. Nhat nheo nhu nuoc soi. Khong the goi la Pho. Sieu do. Khong the an Lan 2. Chi Nen an garlic noodle. Dung an pho.
author: Anh Thu D.

description: Super fresh greens.  you can tell the cleanliness and freshness of their food by the bean sprouts.
author: Nick H.

description:
I seriously don't know why all the other reviews said that the waiters were rude and that the services was bad ! I came in tonight, Saturday night - peak time. Almost all of the tables were occupied and I was still greeted was a warm smile. They must have stepped up their game and hired more servers because if I'm counting correctly, there are 3 waiters and 1 cashier tonight. My server (didn't catch her name) did everything with a smile, even refilled all of the guests' water!

The place was lit. Literally. You can see it from the other side of the street, from Kevin's Noodle House. Since Kevin close at 9PM on the weekend, we decided to give PPQ a try and I'm glad we did. Their #1 Special (The-Everything-Combination pho) was sooooo good. Broth was perfect. Meat-to-noodles ratio was fair. Their medium bowl was around $8~ but it sure filled me up. Will come back in the future to try their 5 Spices Chicken!
author: Quynh X.

description: PPQ: 15 years ago you were divine, but every year I come back, your pho broth gets more watery and less fragrant/umami. Don't try to sneak this past us, man. Brew your broth with more pride -- you're better than this.
author: Ken H.

description: This is usually our place for curry chicken pho'. However, the few times we've eaten here, the curry is always lacking something. The flavor is not as good as it used to be. May need to find a new place. But their imperial rolls are still rockin' it!
author: Nance L.

description:
Get: 

- 5 spice chicken!!!!!!!!! 
- Imperial roll
- egg-condensed-milk-soda
author: Elsie W.

description:
Terrific pho restaurant!

I ordered the yelp favorite, curry chicken noodle soup, and it was delicious! It has a nice kick to it, but it's not overbearingly spicy. At about $9 for a medium, you're getting a high quality dish. Considering that it was 9pm when we went, it was a 20 minute wait. I suggest coming here during lunch hours to be seated right away. 20 minutes isn't that long of a wait, but I can't recall any other time I've waited for a bowl of pho. However, I did live in San Jose for 7 years where pho restaurants were plentiful and you had many places to choose from. 


This is a solid 4 star restaurant and I highly recommend trying it!
author: Briana H.

description:
Brah. This place got good noodles.
Whether it's stewed beef lai mien (handdrawn noodles), or mohinga, or simply pho, I'm there. Garlic noodles is a good move here. If you go pho, you better be able to eat for a family. 
Everything is afforable.
author: Andy L.

description: Absolutely delicious. I used the delivery service doordash and got the veggie summer rolls and a vegetable pho. My delivery arrived sooner than I expected and the food my goodness the food. The summer rolls were warm and soft, FRESH! My pho was flavorful and spicy like I like it. The only comment I would have to make is smaller pieces of veggies in the soup; I'd still eat it either way. Delicious
author: Riya F.

description: This place is amazing. I dropped my wallet here last night. I had about $500 cash, credit cards, debit cards my ID in there!!! I couldnt sleeep. I dont know how it fell out of my pocket but it did and im glad it didnt drop anywhere else because when i came back the next morning(before opening time) they happily handed my wallet back to me. They checked my ID before giving it back. Im so thankful. Not a dollar missing. The workers here have good morals. If it was anybody else, i probably wouldn't have got my wallet back. Thank you kind souls This place has amazingly nice workers !!! The food is good too. Tip well my friends !!! Im definitely coming back. Next time im eating here im tipping $100.
author: Jack J.

description:
Save your time and go to Kevin's across the street. 

Service was completely great until we went up to split our bill with two cards and cash. Our total came up to $40.73. We gave her $20 in cash first then asked to split what was left over for the two remaining cards. However, she transacted $10 onto each of the cards first and then the $20 bill. So, of course, we had a remaining $0.73 left over to which she overreacted and asked how we would pay it. 
She then proceeded to question our tipping RIGHT when I was writing my part of the tip on my receipt.  I almost wanted to put a line through what I wrote and leave, but I'm too nice of a person to even do so.  
As I was a server myself, I understand tips go long ways.  But, I would NEVER ask a guest for a tip. I suggest working on a whole lotta guest service.
Won't be coming back anytime soon.
author: Melissa T.

description: Simply Amazing! This is one of the best pho I've ever had! I tried the charbroiled beef patty curry pho. I loved every spoon of it! My friend was telling me about this place for the longest time and boy she did not disappoint! I would definitely be back here again!
author: Milad S.

description:
What happened to this place? It used to be my favorite pho restaurant until tonight, specifically because of their rich, flavorful curry chicken pho. I've been craving it after not having it for months so we came here for dinner only to be disappointed by the watered down broth that hardly tasted like curry. Ugh. The charbroiled pork rolls were also smaller than I remember. 

I hope it was just an off night because I don't know anywhere else that serves curry pho. :(
author: Stephanie G.

description:
Always a fan. This place does not disappoint!! My family loves getting pho here, I have always always gotten the same pho- satay beef pho #5 . lol and recently I was yelping, and I saw that everyone was raving about the Coconut Curry Pho Noodle #8, so i had to get on the hype to see what it's about!! and LONG AND BEHOLD! IT WAS AMAZINGGGGG it reminded me very much like tom yum kha in a way, it's curry like, with cream, and a little sour... i loveeeeeed it! so much that i had to get the number of the item, No. 8!! remember it! Thanks fellow Yelpers! I have a new favorite now. I like mine with pho noodles than the rice soft noodles it comes with. 

And then my mom and sis got the satay pho, and our all time favorite beef carpaccio for appetizer. NOM NOM NOM so yummy, the acidic sauce on the raw meet. YUM! This was all take out by the way, and still so good. The owner was very generous, we asked for a little more soup as the soup isn't enough for when we cook it at home, he was so kind to give us extra soup. YAY! I'm definitely in love with this place. 

There's always almost a wait for this place since they're so popular, so if you have a big party... good luck! lol :)
author: Cindy C.

description: We had a small beef noodles, still is large enough for us girls in breakfast. The food is ordinary.
author: Yingjie G.

description:
My girlfriend and I decided to come here for lunch to try it instead of kevin's noodle house, which is our usual pho spot. We ordered the xl #1 beef noodles and bun rieu (tomato crab noodles).

My first impression of tasting the beef broth was that it was quite bland, but it tasted much better after adding some fish sauce to it. Same goes for the bun rieu broth. While PPQ may have better quality beef, it is also about 2$ more than kevin's, which is not worth it. The bun rieu was mediocre. There was a ton of noodles in the bun rieu and not much meat, but for 10.25 it still wasn't worth it. 

Overall, I would stick to kevin's for beef pho since their broth taste much better and it is also cheaper. I would come back for the bun rieu since kevin's does not offer it on their menu.
author: Andy Z.

description: Absolutely love PPQ, and always hit this place when in SF.  I highly recommend the 5 spice chicken pho.  I've never seen any other place make this.  Also, the Vietnamese coffee is brewed old school in a little tin filter, and you drink it at the end.  It's definitely a lost art of brewing Viet cofffee!  Get there early because there's normally a wait.
author: Barnaby W.

description:
I haven't been to PPQ in a hot minute (over 2 years) and I knew I would order the Chicken curry vermicelli! I also got vietnamese iced coffee but I guess I should have told them I didn't want to wait for the coffee to finish dripping... I'm impatient.

It's a great spot to satisfy your comfort food craving. It's not the cleanest restaurant you can go to but it's close to my house and gets the job done.
author: Stefanie S.

description: I come here quite often and haven't been disappointed yet. My favorite has to the curry soup! And this place is fairly cheap for the amount of food you get.
author: Sofia H.

description: Soup have no flavor anymore gives you little bit of meat for #2 I don't recommend this place to anyone anymore
author: Saige A.

description:
- decent pho
- quick service
- wish there was more meat in my pho
author: Sherry L.

description:
Jamie W. and I caught the near-tail-end of Hardly Strictly Bluegrass watching Dwight Yoakam have an onstage hissy fit about his bleeding finger when we realized we didn't want to struggle with the crowds who would pour back into the eastbound MUNI express buses. We were a short stroll from 19th Avenue and Irving, so I thought it would be a good opportunity to try Pho Phu Quoc since we both like Perilla a lot. That's the mini-chain of Vietnamese restaurants that shares the same owner. This pretty standard-looking place looks to be just as popular - although we were lucky to catch it in between waves of dining packs.

Pho Phu Quoc doesn't have quite the same menu as there is a greater emphasis on - big surprise! - pho, as we saw a lot of slurp-worthy bowls on the other tables around us. Jamie impressed me by ordering the $9.50 Papaya Salad with Shrimp, which was quite refreshing after a long afternoon at the park with julienned papaya, basil and carrots topped with poached shrimp, chopped peanuts and fried shallots (see photo). It was a nice mix of textures and flavors - crunchy, sweet and slightly savory. We followed this with a $6.75 plate of Imperial Rolls, three of them deep-fried, cut in half and stuffed with ground pork, taro, shredded carrots and silver noodles with a ramekin of puckery nuoc mam sauce (see photo).

Not so healthy a choice but delicious nonetheless. We both went for the $9 rice plates for our entrees which come with a bit of a side salad and more of the nuoc mam sauce. Jamie ordered the Charbroiled Pork Rice Plate, which was very much like a plate you can order at Hahn's Hibachi (see photo). Foolproof and tasty but not terribly unique in execution. Mine was more unusual, the Shredded Pork, Charbroiled Pork & Baked Egg-Loaf Rice Plate, a combination plate of savory carnivery with the egg-loaf a frittata-like creation that must surely have Gallic origins (see photo). Quite good with a good variety of flavors. We'll definitely make a return visit when we're in the 'hood, probably to try the pho. People were really slurping that loud and clear.

FOOD - 4 stars...good, sturdy, no-frills Vietnamese well executed
AMBIANCE - 3 stars...standard-looking
SERVICE - 3.5 stars...fast and furious
TOTAL - 4 stars...worthy fare if you're in the area
author: Ed U.

description:
I love the soup here. But the last few times I came, they we're already out of their bun reiu. 

gross, but I have found foreign objects in my food, pieces of plastic, hair....shamefully, I will still eat here.
author: Serena L.

description:
Pork chop over rice is delicious. The meat is tender and rich in flavors. Five spice chicken is a must if you come here.

However, the lady owner at the front of the restaurant needs to learn how to greet her customers with a smile. She's always grumpy. It's hard to fully enjoy your meal with her ugly frown staring at you.
author: Hoang T.

description: The service was quick but the amount of noodles in the medium and large bowl seemed like it was the same, just the bowl size and soup amount was different. Nonetheless it was still yummy :) The garlic noodles were delicious and would definitely recommend!!
author: Kotoko T.

description:
The best Vietnamese place in the city! Seriously every dish is perfectly made and so tasty!!

Get the pho tai, imperial rolls, curry vermicelli soup, charbroiled pork rice plate or garlic noodles or vermicelli bowl, or anything it's alllll good!
author: Clay C.

description: Back again a year later to see if anything has changed but unfortunately, their beef pho broth is still bland and flavorless.
author: Briget P.

description:
I've been wanting to try PPQ for some time now since it's pretty close to my girlfriends house.  However, there's another Vietnamese place that's about 5 blocks closer so it can be a bit more challenging to get motivated to make the trek.  However, I had been working from Starbucks all day and it was right next door, making lunch there an easy choice.

I ordered their popular chicken curry noodle soup, which I saw at least half a dozen others enjoying. I'm glad I did because it was delicious, refreshing, and didn't make me feel terrible after finishing a large bowl, soup and all.  The chicken was tender and the curry was coconut milk based, which happens to be my favorite.  I was a big fan and for under $10 for a large, it was a bargain as far as I was concerned.

There's many choices in the Inner Sunset that makes any dining decision difficult.  PPQ stands out as a quality restaurant with tasty noodle soups and it's easy to see why their curry is so popular.  I'm going to have a tough time trying anything else when I come back.

Food: 8/10

Service: 7/10

Price: $

Atmosphere: 7/10
author: Joe M.

description: This was the best Pho I've ever had in life so far! My friend brought me to this restaurant while I was visiting San Fran. The first restaurant I had in San Fran was horrible and I was hoping I didn't get the same from another restaurant. I go in and it is packed to the brim. I was able to get a small table by the window and wait on my friend to park. I bought the #5 and my friend got the oxtail Pho. The food came out quickly! My first bite was absolutely amazing! Tears rolled from my face because it was so tasty. Just thinking about it makes my eyes water up! I can't wait to visit San Fran again!!! For the #5 and the awesome imperial rolls!
author: Krystal T.

description: Pretty good pho place in SF.I would go back again . The place is very convenient the pho come out super quikly .
author: Amy L.

description: If you order Pho, it meets the standard. However, I'm not sure with other dishes . One time I ordered combination rice plate, and there was mold on my meatloaf. I didn't want to make a big deal out of it, so I discreetly told them. They gave me steamed vegetables as the replacement of meatloaf. First of all,  why on earth would someone give their customers vegetable for substitute  when they order freaking meatloaf? I'm not a vegan!!!! Finally, they still charged everything on the table, except the steamed vegetables that o barely touched . Therefore, eat here or don't .
author: Tri T.

description:
4 stars for their bun bo hue, 3 stars for their inconsistent pho. 

PPQ is really no different than any other pho restaurant, but the quality of their pho soup is never consistent. It's good for a couple visits, then on your 4th or 5th visit it's gone to shit. Flavorless and oily. Kevin's across the street may have oily broth, but at least the flavor is consistent. 

The BBH, on the other hand, has been consistent and is very good. It's not as spicy as I'd like, but that's not as important as the flavor. The BBH comes with a good amount of meat -- there's three different kinds (sorry, do not know the names of each), and you get at least 3 slices of each. No pig's blood, which is totally fine with me. They also don't give cabbage, but I don't mind that either. You do get the typical bean sprout plate. 

Another consistent thing for PPQ is their rice dishes. I've never had it myself, but my friends like the rice dishes here more than at Kevin's.

Bun bo hue? Yes. Pho? I hope you're lucky.
author: Doris K.

description: Ordered (1) 5-spice chicken with rice, and another with garlic noodle. The chicken proportions were humongous. The 5 pieces of chicken were sliced thick and looked like spare ribs (without the ribs). Will return to try other dishes.
author: Wayne Y.

description:
prices are reasonable but compare to Kevin's noodle house across the block its expensive especially their beef stew wide noodle soup. $10.25 for a large when it doesnt even look big and Kevin is only 8.25 and soo good and flavorful!

And i agree with all the reviews the lady cashier is rude. She never smiles nor say anything? Shes just there to collect money.

next time when im craving for beef stew ill be heading over to Kevins!
author: Carol Y.

description:
Went here after a workout because Underdogs was an hour wait due to the second half of the warriors game being on. meh. 

I ordered the chicken curry soup which was pretty tasty, but I wish they used the regular rice noodles that they used for pho instead of the vermicelli noodles. It's a dish that needs  more texture, so I put as many bean sprouts as I could from our veggie plate. I'd give it a 3. 

My boyfriend ordered number 3, but his broth was so bland as if it was just hot water. -1 

Maybe we should have went for the garlic noodles cause those at least smelled amazing. not sure if we'd go back. But a decent back up to get us out of the cold.  


Oh, and they're open until 11pm, so no rush to leave.
author: Samantha M.

description: PPQ has been one of my go-to pho places ever since I was little. I'd usually stop by if the line at Kevin's noodle house was ridiculously long. I think after 10 years this have finally become my favorite pho place. I really like their number 8. I forget the name of it, but its a chicken curry broth. It's ridiculously good and i'm always craving it! If you don't like your soup spicy you can ask them to tone it down a little (: . As far as the cleanliness of this place, it's like any other Asian restaurant.. LOL great good, but not so great on keeping the place spotless. I can deal with it so I always come back! OHH, I totally forgot to mention the imperial rolls. They're are delicious! Probably the best in the city!!
author: Kelly S.

description: My husband and I like the Five Spice chicken pho and the imperial vermicelli noodles.
author: Dianne Jay S.

description:
If anyone knows me, they know that pho is one of my favorite dishes in this world. I love the soft rice noodles, the hearty broth, and just the saltiness of the dish. So when I went out of San Francisco and tried other places, I was just thinking that it isn't as satisfying as this place right here! This is definitely my go to place. I'll come here pretty often for my pho fix. With that being said, let's jump into talking about the service and food quality!

CUSTOMER SERVICE/AMBIANCE: this small restaurant is located on Irving. Isn't the most convenient place for me, but you can take the 28 and get dropped off right near it. It's a pretty humble size, but I've never been when it was super packed. I get seated right away, and they usually let you just choose a place to sit. I get a menu and they offer tea at no extra charge, which is nice. I only get pho here, haven't tried the imperial rolls here, but I want to try! Waiter/waitresses here are pretty nice and understanding. Recently I decided to try and customize my meat combination, and they happily did so with no trouble. So I like that a lot! The waitress I usually see there always refills my water and checks in on me. She's very nice! I think the one thing that cracks me up is hearing 96.9 KOIT on the radio they play while I'm eating. Nothing is better than listening to Kelly Clarkson while slurping on my meal! Haha. There are always chopsticks, spoons, and condiments on the table. Would rate ambiance 4.5/5. Not a full rating since I just feel like the women at the cash register aren't the friendliest. However, nothing is super horrible about the vibes from this place. I come here for the delicious pho! Let's talk about that real quick. 

FOOD QUALITY/PRICE: When I first started coming, I would get a medium #1. However, i don't really fancy tendon or tripe, so instead now I get the well done brisket, flank steak, and meatballs with thin noodles and beef broth. It's DELICIOUS. Not sweet like some other places I've been. It's nice and salty, and very filling. I add some mint leaves, lime, and it's amazing. Seriously one of my favorite places taste wise. Overall, I end up paying under 10 dollars for my pho since that's all i get. However I tip pretty generously, so usually I end up paying around $11.50. I'm going to try their imperial rolls soon, since many seem to enjoy them!

Overall, this is a great find. However I've always been curious about Kevin's noodle house across the street here. Might try it, and update on which one I prefer. However I feel like I'm so attached to this place. Keep on doing good stuff PPQ. 4.5/5!
author: Kiki C.

description: The food here is pretty good. Portion sizes were just right. I ordered the Imperial egg roll and it was really good and the spring roll was awesome. The let down was my garlic noodle as it was cold. Otherwise reasonable priced and quick service.
author: Aileen A.

description:
Greedy ...


3 large bowl of soup #1. Served with tiny plate of bean sprout and one stem of mint, seriously, 3 large soup. And price differences to medium is like a dollar. The difference in ingredients is meat ball.. i found one meatball in my soup.
author: J C.

description: PPQ has got great Chicken Curry Pho! It is consistently good, with healthy portions of noodles, chicken breast and potatoes. Unlike the broth used in other (beef) pho dishes, the broth for this curry has coconut milk - a Northern Vietnamese style - and chili oil that makes so savory! I have been coming here for about 10 years and it is consistently good! The lines on the Sunday I visited were about 30 minutes long, which is an good indicator of how popular PPQ is!
author: Mystery S.

description:
This probably leans more to 3.5 stars, but you're on the border of Inner / Outer Sunset and you're probably cranky from all the traffic and fog on 19th ave, so this will bump up your food cravings.

PPQ will fill it. Cheap food, cheap service, cheap interior, but good solid pho and food. That's probably more like a 3 star, but the bump comes from having a "different" and almost signature like dish that I really enjoyed in the curry chicken vermicelli noodle. Man, a real good spicy broth filled with chicken and noodles that really satisfied the craving I had for some cheap good Chinese food out in the Sunset.

Come here and grab that. Grab the imperial rolls too, they're pretty tasty. All in all, solid food and got in and out in a reasonably quick manner. Of course parking anywhere in the Sunset is a pain so take this all with a caveat. 

Cheers!
author: Joseph L.

description:
More of a 3.5! My review is only based on my to-go order/experience. I never ate in the restaurant itself.  

So after my roommate raved about PPQ & their Coconut Curry Chicken Pho, we both decided to phone in a to-go order about an hour before they closed. The guy who picked up was basically a "get to the point" kinda guy & hung up. Our other roommates were already on Irving so conveniently we had them pick up our food.  About 15 minutes later, we got a call from my bf saying that they had run out of the coconut curry broth. REALLY? I honestly don't get what they expected us to do... get there & realize they were out and have us wait even longer for a new, different order....? Like brehhhh---but whatever, no big deal. We both ended up ordering 2 orders of the garlic noodles, 5 spiced chicken, & imperial rolls.  It came with a side of fish sauce with some red peppers or something in them. Anyways, I was pleasantly surprised because the order was HUUUUGE & I was not expecting such large cuts of chicken! I know PPQ & Perilla are owned by the same people, but for some reason I felt like Perilla's garlic noodles tasted better? The noodles were a bit on the greasy size, but I still ate most of it. Ha! The chicken & imperial rolls were also pretty tasty, even better with the fish sauce.  Overall, I enjoyed the food, but I would've preferred less oil/grease on our noodles & wished they would have given us more a heads up about a Coconut Curry Pho. Some guests wouldn't be as chill as me, so eventually that kind of practice might catch up to them. I will be returning though--hopefully dining in!
author: Julie Ann B.

description: Super consistent, super delicious. I get the same thing everytime-5 spices spring rolls and the chicken curry pho.
author: Beau G.

description:
This place is basic. Like absolutely basic. I do not know how else to describe it. Basic pho. Basic rice plates. Basic everything. You can find these dishes in any other Vietnamese restaurants so there's really nothing special. My boyfriend's friend raved about this place literally every time I see him so I was curious to see what he was talking about. He told me the imperial rolls and coconut curry are the only food items that I needed to order.  

Of course, I don't listen to his coconut curry recommendation because I do what I want. Lol just kidding. I was not in the mood for curry that night, and a light dish such as a pork vermicelli sounded appealing. My boyfriend got pho and ordered the infamous imperial rolls. Food came out super quick. Looking at both of our dishes, there was no love put into it at all. Literally, they threw crap together and called it a day. I was pretty appalled by what my dish looked like because I've been to countless Vietnamese restaurants and I've never seen such sloppiness. The pho barely had any meat. All I saw my boyfriend eating was hella noodles, which is not okay. Additionally, I had to flag down the waiter to give us the bean sprouts which should come with the pho from the start.

On top of all of this, the imperial rolls never came. The imperial rolls are an appetizer, which should come before our main dishes. Hence the word appetizer. The pho came out first, and I already had the feeling they forgot about our imperial rolls because before I knew it, the pork vermicelli noodles came out next. When we made a point to our waitress about not receiving the imperial rolls, she did not give any sort of apology and really, did not give a crap. Ummm.....good bye. Now thinking about it, I totally regret leaving any tip at all.  

Next time, I'll give this place another chance for their curry and imperial rolls for the sake of our friend, but if it weren't for him, just no. We would have been better off at Kevin's right across the street. What an utter disappointment.
author: Veda T.

description: Had lunch here with some friends on a weekend. Ordered the five spice chicken with garlic noodles since it was recommended to me. The garlic noodles were really good. You could taste the butter and garlic. Sadly, the give spice chicken was not as awesome. Maybe my expectations were too high but I didn't find it life-changing. The wife had the pho and it was pretty good. Overall, it was ok. Get the garlic noodles.
author: Benjamin L.

description:
As soon as you order your meal, do you clock them on how fast you'll get your food?

With very little time for my lunch, I ordered the restaurant's: "Bun Gia Yau Thit Nhoung" for $8.00 and the "three-color" drink for $3.00. 

As soon as I placed my order, I shuffled various songs on my Nano. Among the 8,000 songs on my device, I had a choice between a short song and a long song. I debated between the short Judas Priest's hit "Breaking the Law" or the long extended version of New Order's "Blue Monday". 

I chose "Breaking the Law". (I'm sure many of you are disagreeing my decision of songs). 

Before the JP's three-minute tune ended, I got my noodle bowl and my drink. Now that is fast, even for a busy midday!

The noodle was soft, the grilled pork was charred nicely and the egg roll was piping hot. My noodle Bowl: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/9QXEJdRizwCYBjGX_go_Qw?select=sHoBHG-_0DM31dtbd2LJKA

The cold drink has jelly, red bean and coconut milk...yum! My drink: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/9QXEJdRizwCYBjGX_go_Qw?select=cXVpXnrKMN5F3trZfrrD2Q

As I was enjoying my meal, I was playing Beethoven's Fifth Symphony Number 9 on my player with my huge Dr. Dre's Beats headphone in front of the lunch crowd. 

I bet many of you wanted to see my unusual collections of tunes on my Nano. 

"Here, check it out!"
author: Matt G.

description:
Overall Impression: Good price point but the portions were pretty small this time around. My gf and I agree that the five spice chicken is the highlight of the night.

Cost: Around 8.50 for a medium and 10 for a large pho. Garlic noodles were 10.

Taste: Delicious five spice chicken that came with the garlic noodles, which were a little on the dry side. We also experimented with the pho in curry broth and it was surprisingly a good choice. The broth turned out to be a lot better than many Thai places that I go to.

Customer Service: Food came out quickly.

Ambience/Atmosphere: The first thing I noticed is that the place is very clean. Like immaculately clean. This is a big plus for this place.
author: Kevin T.

description:
I'm just not a big fan of the place. My buddy and I have discussions all the time about PPQ and Kevin's. Like, I'll eat here if I'm with him, but maybe not on my own. I'll give it to PPQ for those imperial rolls, but unfortunately last time I went to show my girlfriend how good the rolls were they forgot to even bring me my order for them! 

As for pho, I'd go with Kevin's. I ordered the rare flank and beef ball here and didn't like the balance of ingredients. There were about 5-6 pieces of medium size flank and 4 beef balls. On the contrary they gave me way too much noodles. It's definitely filling, but I'd rather have more meat and flavor. I also would've preferred more green onions and cilantro.

All in all, it was meh.

Meh.
author: Micki H.

description:
Let me just say - this has been a ten day journey of Pho - got home just before Xmas this year and came down with a nasty, nasty Cold/Flu - have literally had Pho each and every day (Jan 2 now) since - mostly have been to Turtle Tower and Pho Phu Quoc - now, I am a mixed beef Pho person - plain and simple and do go back and forth on Turtle's Northern Style in its so very rich broth (my lord that is good) to its pure ingredients - have even begun to taper  my historic need to add Siracha until my eyes bleed (love that sauce) to enjoy the pure flavor of Turtle Tower - and then, I get to Pho Phu, and really enjoy the Southern inspired version whereby adding in Basil, Jalapeno, & Sprouts plus good Siracha makes the soup...can really go back and forth.

BUT - tried the famous Curry Chicken Pho here and WOW - am a believer now in that - the sweet/savory/spicy nature of the broth is SOOO addicting and good - great cure all for colds, but can be sought after anytime once you've tried it - my nitpik is that the underlying broth can be a bit watery versus a typical savory Chicken Pho Broth - I attribute this to the fact that they add in the curry and spiceness which can make the effort to also include a multi stage broth seem too much, but I think if you did that, you might achieve a higher meaning in life!!!!! (just my two cents) - regardless, the Pho is worth it - great ingredients in simply rice noodles and chicken.

Also of note - their breaded Calamari and Imperial Rolls - both outstanding - the breading and cut on the Calamari is unique in that is it a very healthy cut of Calamari steak bites vs ringlets and the breading is WOW - crunchy, flavorful, and damn good!  Imperial rolls are also worthy of note with a great wrapping and filling that are tops in Bay Area.
author: Richard D.

description:
Being a complete Vietnamese food snob.. this place was disappointing.  Oh maaaaaan! I ordered the bun bo hue and it was... no, no and no. They were missing MANY of the toppings that were listed on the menu. LAAAAAAME! The broth wasn't spicy at all and yeah... not worth my $8. I gave them an extra star because they were attentive.. but that's it. Maybe I'll try the five spice chicken over vermicelli but that's it. 

Sigh again. My hunt for good Vietnamese food in the city has failed me again. Guess I have to go back to San Jose.
author: Kenitha Y.

description:
My friends really like coming here to eat, and I think I've been here for about -4 times. Each time I've been here, the food was decent, and it hits the spot if you want noodle soup and don't want to wait for the other places that have long lines for noodle soup in the Sunset district.

I've gotten the 5 Spices Chicken Noodle Soup. I actually really like the 5 spices chicken-- it's very flavorful and they give you a pretty good portion of chicken! The noodles and soup that comes with it are decent, making this meal my favorite out of the menu.

And then I also started ordering the Bun Rieu. The only other place I had Bun Rieu at was at a winning Vietnamese restaurant in San Diego. This Bun Rieu was good, but it wasn't as good as what I've had before. I think my expectations of the Bun Rieu may be high, but their Bun Rieu broth was kind of tomato-y and not as flavorful as expected.

Overall, 5 Spices Chicken Noodle Soup is a win. If you're feeling like your stomach can handle more than just greasy soup, get this with the Curry Broth-- it has a LOT of flavor, and they give you the same chicken. :)
author: Grace H.

description: Ordered the combo pho to go and it came with very few meat and a lot of noodles. Not what I expected.
author: Tracy H.

description:
I came here the other day with a few friends and was initially going to Kevin's Noodle House for pho. There was a lot of people so we opt out this place.

We were seated immediately and we all ordered the Bun Bo Hue, Bun Rieu and Combo Pho. The food was made pretty quickly and the staff speaks Chinese :O

My bun rieu was ehh okay. There was nothing special to it. As for my friend's combo pho and bun bo hue, again... nothing special.

I think I would only come back again if there were long lines at other pho places.
author: Elaine C.

description:
Stopped in yesterday for the 1st time after an afternoon at the Botanical Garden. Nice ambiance and very clean. Service was very attentive. 3 of us ordered medium bowls of beef pho with brisket. My hubby tried the chicken curry. We also had the shrimp spring rolls for appetizer. 
Spring rolls were nice and fresh with very zingy mint and tasty peanut sauce that was not overly vinegary.
Pho broth was delish-and on the large size for a medium!! Nice tender noodles and very fresh basil and sprouts. Not the most complex broth I've had-but very good. Brisket was perfect! I never finish my meat in pho. Usually just isn't the best part of the soup.This bowl I ate every bite because it was so flavorful.
My hubby's chicken curry (I tasted) was good too. Very tender, flavorful slices of chicken breast (tasted like it had been marinated 1st) in a light coconutty broth served with ample rice.
We brought home a to go bowl of pho for my other family member and it was packed so nicely with the broth in a plastic tub, the uncooked noodles in a plastic bag, the meat in a little cardboard box, and the sprouts, limes, basil, etc, in another bag. The portions of all were extremely generous-unlike some where you get ripped off when you take it to go! :) 
We will look forward to coming again!
author: Laurie D.

description:
The juiciest, moistest chicken thigh I have ever had! And I eat a lot of chicken. I had the five spice chicken pho, though I wanted the chicken curry, as I guess that's what they are known for, but it was late, I was delirious, and my man said the curry is pretty heavy. I pass by PPQ pretty often as Underdogs next door is my jammy jam, but I've never stopped in. Man and I were trying to sniff out some late-night New Year's pho, and PPQ happened to be open. I will tell you right now: I may never go back to the old pho place again (unless convenience calls).

Everything was fresh and crisp, I thought the service was a little rude, but that's kind of to be expected. Boyfriend got the rare steak pho, which was yummy too. I'm thinking about my leftover pho right now.... oh Lordy.
author: Crystal C.

description: Their five spice chicken is so good! My go-to here is the vermicelli with imperial rolls and chicken; always delicious. The #1 pho is also full of good stuff, although it makes me a little sad that their beef balls are small instead of the large kind I prefer that have bits of tendon embedded. And while their spring rolls will do in a pinch, they're mostly full chock-full of noodle, not too much shrimp. I would say it's a safer bet to go with their fried rolls - cooked perfectly every time I've visited. Either way, in my experience, food always comes out fast and piping hot!
author: Delia Z.

description:
My go to: # 8 curry chicken  vermicelli but I always change it to pho noodles.
My bf's go to: #7 five spice chicken pho

Both are delicious and I love that the broth is pipping hot. One criteria for me in pho is that the soup has to be hot, I hate lukewarm soup. 

When I'm not feeling like something hot, the vermicelli bun noodles are good, don't forget the imperial rolls. I love their filling, I think it is taro, hot and crispy dipped in fish sauce :) 

Yummy!
author: Kelly C.

description:
So dirty..I found a roach  in the vermicelli noodle...
It was so terrible. I don't want to try again... I don't know the woman who was in there at that time was an owner of the restaurant, i saw her face looks like in anger and she yelled at their waiter. I pissed off so much i couldn't finish my meal. It was disgusting. The roach was like dime size length. It reminds me that situation again while i'm writing this. I want to throw up. Even i couldn't take the pic of the noodle. My friend screamed. Some guys saw that thing as well and they just left the restaurant right away after that.
author: Sunyoung H.

description: Still delicious. I enjoy their variety and additions to the menu - it's not traditional pho or Vietnamese but I enjoy having added vegetables to my pho. I'll keep coming here as much as I can!
author: Michael S.

description: When tired of Ben Tre, Kevin's happens. The small  pho is big enough to kill a craving and the large is pretty big. It's good but not mind blowingly good...but I can show you something that is... ;) ...if you're down to try their other location at westlake.
author: Joshua F.

description:
This place took forever to get our bowls of noodle out! My bf ordered the #1 and I got the bun rieu and it took at least 10 minute for his and additional 5 for mine. The bun rieu was super salty, but full of goodies. I like how there were tofu and fishcake added in as oppose to just tomatoes and crab paste. 
The restaurant was kinda grimey looking. There was a giant mosquito flying around while we were eating and I don't like sharing my food (or blood) with insects. 
Trying to flag down a server to pay was difficult as well. Service here is too slow and I'll most likely go to other places to get my pho fix.
author: Renee Y.

description:
Don't get me wrong. This place is good. However this review is solely based on how terrible the wait staff is on up selling or informing you how much something cost when it says otherwise on the menu. 


So I came here with 2 friends and wasn't feeling quite as hungry so I just wanted a side of five spice chicken. It doesn't say anywhere on the menu how much that would be but on the menu it says a side of beef or chicken would be $3. Given this was only maybe for soup, so I would be reasonable if it was up to $5. I didn't want the vermicelli because it would have been too much food. 

When the bill came they charge me f*cking $6.75 for one piece of chicken. WHAT. That was the price of a small pho, 75 cents more and I could have got a god damn vermicelli with imperial rolls. Way to get over on your customers. I think any reasonable restaurant would have asked if I wanted to just get vermicelli cause it's only a few cents more, but naw they didn't cause they wanted more profit.
author: J V.

description: I live 2 blocks away from PPQ and have given it way more chances than it deserves. Bowl of pho is one of the worst in the city, and everything else is incredibly below average. I've ordered things that were practically inedible. I NEVER leave food behind - I will either a) eat everything in one sitting b) take it home as leftovers or c) at least pack it up and give it to a homeless person. Upon my last visit, I didn't consider the effort to be worth any of the above. Two stars for the five spice chicken, and the curry chicken noodle soup as they are somewhat acceptable. Otherwise.... just go to Kevin's across the street.
author: Andrea D.

description:
PPQ wasn't that busy. friendly greetings when i entered. decor not much.

eats: pho tai gan (m 7.75)
-broth very sweet, slightly beefy, definitely full of msg
-noodles not abundant, meats fresh, tender, and scarce
-maybe garlic noodles better choice.

take outs
-order taken, food brought out by kitchen
-no checkins
-vast menu
-related to perilla,  PPQ island?
-doubtful repeat
author: Victor G.

description: I never leave reviews but this is just ridiculous. Waited 10 mins to get out menu. Waited another 10 mins for them to come take our orders. Both times we had to raise our hands like we're in elementary schools. Left without ordering. Taking our money and spending it elsewhere.
author: Emily T.

description:
Wow , what great food , delicious , clean , hot  food, my new find is the Vietnamese Carpaccio ( raw beef) soooooo good , I have eaten all the Pho noddle soup and find this change fun and delicious for a little $
Ann Chu
author: walton c.

description: simple whole in the wall spot , seems to be full just about every time i come in. Food is decent.
author: Mario S.

description: Five spiced chicken rice plate is the way to go! The rice plates here all pretty good and tasty. Pho here is expensive and not worth your money so go somewhere else if you can. Service can be slow if it's really busy and the wait can be long.
author: Monica W.

description:
Some friends wanted to get some pho so I tagged along.

This review is going to be pretty tough. The food here was pretty good and I enjoyed my meal enough to want to give the place four stars, but the service and lack of vegetarian options made me take another star down.

Both my friends are vegetarians and sought after vegetarian pho. There was vegetarian pho on the menu, but it's cooked in beef broth...that's cheating! There are some vegetarian options on the menu, but they were pretty limited. Luckily, they did enjoy the meal that they settled for.

I ordered the curry chicken pho (Medium, $6.75, chicken pho infused with curry spices and coconut milk). I already knew it was going to be really saturate but....whatever. It tasted really good. 

My friend ordered the egg yolk soda ($2.50, soda water/condensed milk/egg yolks) out of curiosity. He didn't like it, so I drank the rest of it. I quite liked it a lot actually. The taste is very similar to flan, but has that carbonation. My friend didn't like the carbonation which I can understand. It's kind harsh against such a generally creamy flavor. 

Our server was very curt and seemed rushed. Placing our order was awkward for us because we'd say an order and he'd leave because he thought we were done ordering. 

Later on, we waited over ten minutes for our check. We made it obvious that we were waiting. We assumed they knew because they took some things away from our table but we were left forgotten. Other people got their checks before us. I'm generally very patient, but wow.

Okay place.
author: Sofia R.

description:
I've been here many times in years past, but just got reacquainted with this restaurant after a long hiatus. I have to say that I was impressed by the food. I like that they have a lot of specialty noodle soups. We had the crab noodle soup (bun rieu) and it had good flavor. It looks like they improved their formula from before and made it a permanent part of the menu. And we had their imperial rolls and charbroiled beef vermincelli. I remembered their imperial rolls being good and they were just that. There wasn't too much beef in this dish but it was still good. Portions were enough so you'll be nice and full.

Other items that I really liked here:
-Curry chicken noodle soup (white meat and no bones)
-Satay Beef Noodle Soup (if you're in the mood for something a little spicy)

The bathroom is not very nice, but the food will bring me back for future visits.
author: Ali F.

description: The lady at the front is extremely rude and unprofessional for no reason at all. Their pho isn't even that great. Took thirty minutes to get to our table. Only plus is that they're open until 11.
author: Jared B.

description:
I love PPQ, especially their flank steak is delicious. After coming here a month later, did the customer service go downhill?

I ordered the number 1 which had everything in it. I clearly stated "Can I get the number 1 in medium?" But when the waitress came back, she gave me a bowl of spicy pho. I would NEVER in my life order something spicy. So I asked her if they changed their menu cause I don't recall number 1 being spicy. Then she said this is number 8. I told her I didn't order number 8 but number 1. Instead, she had the nerve to argue back and didn't have the courtesy to bring it back to the kitchen and give me a number 1, the one I ordered. What happened to the phrase "the customer is always right". But no.. Instead of causing such a fuss, I decided to eat it. 

I asked for a separate bowl to a waitress but she gave me a to go box. So I said "No, can I get a bowl so I can share with my brother to eat in?" She came back giving me a bigger to go box. Then I said "Nooo, I meant  a bowl to EAT IN HERE." 

I seriously don't know what's going on with the service. I probably went on a bad day but it wasn't that busy as usual. 

Looks like I won't be coming here in a while.
author: Sarah F.

description:
While looking for a Pho place in SF we decided to give this place a try. 

We both ordered the combination. It was pretty disappointing. Very little meat (few slices of meat and A meat ball), very clear almost flavorless broth and a whole lot of noodles. The basil and sprouts were very fresh. The pho here did not hit the spot.

We received tea when we were seated but the water we requested never made it to our table.

We order some garlic noodles. These were really good and worth going back for but I do not recommend the pho.
author: Joanna Z.

description: I would have put five stars here 3 years ago, four stars a year ago and here I am, disappointed in giving three stars; it has just been those kinds of experience at PPQ. From service which has always been old-school, their stellar food quality had once made up for this. Now even food hasn't been too kind lately. For the past two visits the pho broth and meat just tastes bland and stale (even for weekends, you would think they would put their best stuff out), and lemongrass pork I had gotten was dry and lackluster in every sense, thoroughly leaving me to regret that I had a) given the place another go and b) the $15 I am going to be short having a dish that quite frankly you can get elsewhere cheaper and just plain better. Hope this place picks it up but you can sense even as you pass this place on weekends, it simple does not have the long lines you once used to see out the door.
author: Al L.

description: Been here a couple of times. The service is fast even when packed. The inside is small. But, the food is good. I forgot what I ordered but I had a huge bowl with seafood in it. Great choice for me and it was filling. Yes, that's how I like it. Oh, and the thai tea is good here as well.
author: Robert F.

description:
I'm surprised it took me this long to try out this spot because I go to Kevin's noodle house across the street a decent amount of times. I did not try the pho so I can't comment who has better pho..but I did try the curry chicken soup..and dayummmmm is it delish! *drool face* it's a milkier soup base, I think coconut? So good!!! And for toppings they had chicken which was soft and juicy, not dry at all. They also has some potatoes as the vegetable topping. Omg, not healthy at all, but yummy.

I unfortunately did not take a picture of my meal before I demolished the entire noodle soup, but there are plenty of pictures on yelp for your viewing pleasure. Yes, I am so glad I went with the popular item. Now if I am ever in the mood for eating curry chicken noodle soup (I never even knew that COULD be a craving) I will hit this place up! 

We also got some spring rolls since I'm a big fan of spring rolls. They were wrapped really nicely and advertised as 6 pieces, but in reality they were like two regular sized pieces cut into 6. Also filled with noodles...at least put more lettuce!? I can't have this many..carbs.. Along with that soup base..ahh!! 

Yea, hopefully these cravings won't hit too often.
author: Stephanie W.

description: I go to PPQ once every couple of months and my experience there is always delightful. The food is great,  the atmosphere is great, and the people are great. My favorite item on the menu is the vermicelli with five spice chicken and imperial rolls. The price of the dish is reasonable because the portion is big. Everytime I leave the restaurant, I always leave with a full stomache
author: Tiffany L.

description:
Whenever it's cold, I crave a hot bowl of pho!  Favorite dish here #8 Coconut Curry Chicken but substitute it was Five Spice Chicken and Egg Noodles!!  Love it!!

I also enjoy the imperial rolls!! My boyfriend loves their rice plates!  Very tasty! 

Food gets to your table really fast too!!
author: Candice V.

description: We've been here twice (takeout) and both times ordered the exact same thing - pho, fried spring rolls, and rice w egg loaf shredded pork and charbroiled pork. The first time all the dishes were great. The second time, the pho broth tasted like water and the ONE meatball was still cold. The spring rolls were good but they really don't give you much meat in the rice dish. Overall this place is just ok.  Yummy yummy is much better.  Also, 75 health score?!  Sigh. San Francisco...why can't you get with the program and make these restaurants post letter grades in store front windows like they do in Los Angeles and where it's rare to see anything less than an A.
author: wendy w.

description: First and foremost this place has horrible service. They were slow to take our orders but quick to get us out the door after our meal. I ordered Bun thit noung change gio, which is vermicelli served over a salad with grilled pork or beef with an egg roll. Although the egg roll and meat were cooked well, the noodles were a bit too stuck together and they did not nearly give you enough fish sauce on the side for pouring over your food. Also the fish sauce itself is far too sweet and too salty. The pho here, is decent, the broth could be better and the portion isn't great. Pho is better across the way at Kevin's noodle house.
author: Brandon N.

description:
My favorite thing to get here is always the Fried Imperial Rolls, whether it's in my vermicelli or as an appetizer to share. It can be expensive ($7 for 3 rolls, 6 pieces total) but no other place makes fried imperial rolls so good!

Vermicelli is also good, 5-spice chicken is great, and pho is popular here also. 

Staff can be absent, but what do you expect for a $7 meal. My bf and I would ask for water or tea, or extra sauce several times, but more than half the time never get anything we want. We always get our food though. 

I always seem to get here at the wrong time, and end up waiting around 10 minutes. But as soon as I sit down, the whole restaurant seems to clear out. Go figure.
author: Jocelyn L.

description: Food is fantastic, well priced and large portions.  Came here with a group of 7 on a Sunday night and wait was about 20 minutes.  It's a packed little place with lots of people ordering take out- but they still got our orders correct despite being a bit picky and we were all very happy and very full!
author: Ben S.

description: The curry pho is mind blowing! I enjoy Vietnamese food often and this is above and beyond the best Phó I've ever had.  In a city full of great food this is a must visit every time I come to SF.
author: Craig U.

description:
Eh.
