author: Keyser S.

description: This is our regular Pho place. Even though it's a few dollars more than other places, the portions are good and they give you a lot of meat. We go there specifically for their Satay Beef noodle (#5 on the menu) and their five spice chicken. It's the best that I've had. The service is much friendlier than other pho places. Highly recommend this place.
author: L C.

description: It's usually a good place for a relatively cheap lunch and the food is decent but nothing special.
author: L C.

description:
fresh and hot food,clean, polite, and fast.
vietnamese carpaccio is amazing!
chicken salad too.
author: Rick H.

description:
I didn't realize that this place gets hated on.

Ok fine.  This place might not have the best pho in the world, and it may be slighly over-priced compared to the more authentic pho places on Tully Rd. in San Jose, but it's good and satisfying.  I would choose this place over the other options in the inner sunset.  A solid 3 stars....

...but PPQ, you get 3 stars and my love for consistently frying up imperial rolls to perfection and for giving me the choice of putting my 5-spice chicken either in my bun (on my not so soupy days) or on the side of my pho (on my soupy days).
author: Doris K.

description: I can't believe you people gave this place a big hype and 4-5stars. the pho broth was like water I'm never taking tips from  yelp people again! I was literally eating combination meat and noodle with just hot water and viewers when I say *WATER* I mean it the broth taste like completly nothing even after adding all the condiments.
author: Sam l.

description: This place has the best satay pho i've ever had. Perfectly flavored and awesome. Their service is also great and the restaurant is much cleaner then most pho houses. I literally go there every week.
author: michael l.

description: I come here for the Red Curry Noodle dish. Only down side is that it isn't real curry and very watery, but it's the only place that serves it noodle style in Sunset that I know of. I like this place more than the one across the street.
author: Michael B J.

description: my go-to spot in the sunset for some hangover pho... of course it's good when i'm sober too! i usually get a rare beef and beef brisket pho with an insane amount of jalepenos and my girl gets the chicken curry noodle soup which is pretty damn good. no matter how many times i tell myself i'll get something else, i fall into my old ways and order the pho. however, i think i'll try the five-spiced chicken noddle soup...... one of these days.
author: Brian L.

description: I eat Pho at this Pho house about 2 times a month.  i want to rate this place a 3.5 stars.  The Pho is a solid 3 and the fried imperial rolls are a solid 4.  I use to always get the large Pho Tai or satay Pho.  These two are relatively good but the soup base is not as good as Lois or Kevins Pho house across the street.  I recently have started to order the Curry Chicken Pho and it is pretty good as well (make sure u ask for extra potatoes, they only give you 1 or 2).  What makes this place great is the imperial rolls. I order these appetizers evertime i eat here.
author: Stephen C.

description:
love PPQ and everything on the menu... try the imperial rolls and the famous 5 spice chicken.. 

inexpensive + great food = a great meal!

YUMMY =D
author: margaret c.

description: I got the veggie combo, lot's of food but very bland.  Wasn't aweful but I won't go back.
author: a e.

description: Good Vietnamese fare at a reasonable price and fast service. They stay open fairly late as well. No qualms here....
author: Ti I.

description:
there are few things in life i am sure of, but this i know to be true: it's not legit unless it's got a 2-d wooden cow propped outside. 

at least this is true in the case of PPQ (i like the abbreviation bc otherwise there's no way i would know what to call this place - other than maybe wooden cow pho place). having just moved to outer sunset, finding a good pho place is a staple in life. it's like wardrobe staples- you need a good pair of jeans, a black go anywhere top, a nice button down, etc. Same with food, you need good pho place, weekend brunch spot and a 24 hour slightly shady liquor store within walking distance. 

maybe that last one is not on everyone's staple list.

in any case, PPQ has fast become a food staple. the 5 spice chicken is usually my order, but the spring rolls are also great and leave you surprisingly full for spring rolls. the service isn't great, but i have different standards (read: no standards) for asian restaurants, so you'll have to give a little there. you can call in and order, which is a good idea, as the place is usually pretty crowded - but what can i say? the 5 spice chicken is worth it....and i get to see the cow.
author: Diane L.

description: Locals talk about this place as if the pho is second to none.  My roommate is a pho addict and claims this place to be the best.  Everytime I go there, I stand in line and see hoards of other people waiting also.  It's just basic pho.  Nothing special, nothing fancy, and definitely nothing to boast about.  Looking for parking then having to wait for something so basic deters people who want to eat pho.  I want my big bowl o noodles quickstyle where the concept of waiting is foreign.  They only accept CASH ONLY also.  They make it clear they only accept cash because there are signs inside and out so if you want to wait a long time for some basic pho, make sure you have cash with you.
author: Kelly L.

description: Their pho is decent but not the best.  I like their beef balls...and that gives them the 2 stars. It's always busy and I've never been seated right away. They would've gotten 3 stars if the health department didn't give them a 56. Please restaurant owners, keep your pho places clean...I would come back for your number 4 if you'd just have at least a 70something score!
author: Tiff L.

description: Food was alright. Service is non-existant. When we would try to call them over, they would walk over and stop short at the table before us. They could suck up to some old people at the table right by us, but couldn't give us menus or take our order or get our drinks?! Even if the food were ambrosia, it would've tasted bad because of the lack of service.
author: anocha s.

description:
3.5 stars for the cuisine itself, the grilled pork on skewers is a must try.
However this place is between 1 and 2 stars only overall, I have never eaten in such a stressful place. They let people queue inside the restaurant nearly sitting on your table. It is miserable and makes it a miserable restaurant unless you get a table in the end of the restaurant.
Please get this sorted and make sure customers queue without disturbing current customers.
Ah and they only take cash, no cards. I guess it is easier for tax :)
author: Cedrick C.

description: I don't give a damn what anybody has to say! I LOVE PPQ! Their soups are sooo delicious along with everything else on their menu. I would give it 5 stars but its a long ways from my house so I gotta hitch a ride when I want to go...
author: Spain O.

description:
When I used to live in the Sunset I went here all the time. You'll probably be happy with anything you order, but my favorites are the shredded chicken with flat noodle soup and the 5-spice chicken (either in a soup, or as a rice plate). I'm also a big fan of the imperial rolls. My dad thought their iced tea was fantastic. Very tasty and efficient service.

A word of advice: Try to avoid this place in the evenings, since in the past couple years they've become much more popular and it can get really packed. I'd go during lunch instead.
author: Sasquatch M.

description:
This restaurant has delicious and well-portioned meals for your money. I enjoy their hot pho noodles with beef flanks, etc, and it's amazing how the soups are always served hot, not lukewarm or unfresh. You'd receive a plate of basil and bean sprouts with the noodle orders, but if you'd like more vegetables, their beef skewers platter has plenty of vegetables and meat. 
I don't recommend the chicken salad. The chicken didn't taste very good, and it didn't compare with the good quality of their beef in the noodles.
Try pho at Pho Phu Quoc if you've never tried it, and you may start to enjoy Vietnamese food as I have come to like it!
author: Lula L.

description: I thought everything was delicious.  The coconut curry chicken soup was super tasty, the favorite of the table was the number 0, the pho with this-and-that, including "fancy pork".  The pho with the mixed seafood and pork and stuff, number 00, had the yummiest broth.  Better than the other pho place across the street from there, Kevin's Noodle Shop.
author: Jocelyn K.

description: Pho was pretty average. Broth was not as flavorful as other places.
author: Bucky M.

description: how about you order a taro root drink.. an order of the shrimp rolls...vietnamese carpaccio...and curry chicken vermicelli soup...and call it a day
author: Supah D.

description: I think the pho at Pho Hoa Hiep (across the street) is better but they have the best five spice chicken. My only complaint is the cramped seating space.
author: Kevin T.

description: I go to ppq all the time, i think the food here is WAY BETTER then any other place in the sunset. I've tried so many different things here and i haven't been disappointed. Well expect this one time but it's ok. Their tomato crab noodle soup and curry chicken noodle soup  is awesome. A must try!!!
author: em T.

description:
Do yourself a favor and go across the street to Kevin's Noodle House because this place here is absolutely horrible.  If you want WATER DOWN PHO and a anemic portion of beef than this is the restaurant to go too.  Oh Yeah, a large bowl is a rip off $7.25.

Update: 6/9/08

Open the SF Examiner today 6/9/08 and on page 5 it listed a bunch of resturants with their Health Inspection scores.   Guest what this resturant got?  

54/100 and inspected on 3/17/2008 by the San Francisco Health Department.  

You see that correctly, 54/100!  Wow, what a SANTIZE place, NOT!

They didn't score that much better either in their prior  inspection, 56/100.    

I won't be eating here again!   The inspection score they got is just out right scarey ..... 54/100.   Clealiness isn't this place's specitaly I guess.

You can view the report also on the SF Examiner, June 9/2008, page 5.
author: John S.

description: Super not feeling this place. I'm a pho fanatic so I was excited to find a good place (it had been recommended to me by a vietnamese friend so i had high hopes to start out with). The place looks like and is run like your standard pho/vietnamese restaurant. Bare, basic, no frills, that's fine. But the pho? Was really bland and honestly, not that good. They didn't even give me cilantro to add, just basil and the other sides. Plus, there were no other spices in the broth like onion or garlic, which really does make a difference, just plain ol broth. My hubby's coconut milk soup was yummy, hence the notch up to 2 stars. I took the rest of my soup home because I couldn't finish it and as i type this, the leftovers are stil in my fridge, which is a rarity if I like a dish. OH! And the noodles in my broth were thick, almost linguine style and I was super not feeling that. Don't waste your time with this place. There have got to be better pho places in san fran...at least, i'm hoping....
author: Hanan H.

description: Nice little place in the Sunset.  Absolutely best egg rolls ANYWHERE.  (imperial roll on menu)  Im not a pho fanatic but they have good rice plates.  cold vermicelli noodles are good.  Hands down best 5 spice chicken in the city.
author: david w.

description:
You know the food is good when there's a line of 20+ people stretching out the door!  It was 7:30 when we got to 19th and Irving, and the street was filled with hungry people.  Our friend had suggested that there were two pho places, but only one place had the line. (guess)

PPQ is such a friendly place to go to, and the food was DE-LIC-IOUS!  Well worth the wait of 15 minutes.  The service was extraordinarily fast, and the portions were awesome.  

5 stars for food taste and quality - 1 star for messing up my order + 1 star because the food was GREAT, even though I didn't ask for the fat noodles.  Oh well.  

This place is on the places to visit before you die list for a reason.

I"M GOING BACK!
author: E K.

description: Mmm... sooo yummy! I never thought I'd eat raw beef! Try the Vietnamese Carpaccio (Angus!), with its caramelized scallions, peanuts, and vinegarette you'll be picking the plate for scraps. The beef Pho is fantastic and the curry chicken is awesome but my favorite is still the 5 spice chicken and Imperial rolls! (Wrap the mint leaf AROUND the roll then dip) Yum.
author: Al Stickler X.

description: J and I ate here last night after J's dragon dance practice at a middle school on Ortega. J had the spicy satay beef pho and I ordered the vegetable tofu pho, plus fried veggie rolls that contained taro. J enjoyed his dish very much.  We both liked the imperial rolls. My pho had only type of veggie (chinese broccoli) but the tofu tasted fresh. Unfortunately, either the pho or rolls had much MSG b/c the second I got into the car (J drove), I fell into a stupor and it was the kind of langor that didn't feel welcome. Upon arriving home, I fell into bed and didn't wakeup until 11 hours later. For the rest of today, I felt tired. So far, I'm having two types of MSG reactions: 1. Severe headache or 2. Immediate sleepiness. Woke up thirsty. Also, J informed me the bathroom was not clean. Bill for two including 20% tip was $24.There is a Vietnamese restaurant next to San Tung a few blocks away whose veggie pho I prefer. If I weren't allergic to MSG and didn't care about bathroom cleanliness, I'm sure I would eat at PPQ again. As it stands, I won't be returning. My search for msg-free Pho continues!
author: Grace C.

description:
one of my favorite pho place!
not that many place have the spicy satay beef noodle soup =P
also love their 5-spice chicken & their imperial rolls b/c they use the rice wrapping skin instead of the eggroll wrapping skin
author: Jen C.

description: we eat here at least once a week and live across the city - chicken pho and curry chicken pho never fail and the people are nice.  they don't fawn all over you but all the better as far as I'm concerned
author: M L.

description: I usually go to PPQ for a take out pho or five spice chicken plate, which are both reasonably priced, good portions and tasty. They are good with the phone orders and it's ready when I get there within 10-15 minutes. For those reasons, and the fact that they do it consistently, I keep going back.
author: Marcus M.

description:
well, this was plan b when kevin's wasn't open across the street.  to be fair, i went in with a negative attitude because i really wanted kevin's.  but i tried to give it a fair shot.
i only like brisket and flank steak (cause i'm a weeny) and they don't actually have that combo on their menu. but homeboy said no problem to excluding the tripe for us.  but when they brought out the condiment plate, there wasn't any bean sprouts.  they said they ran out.  wtf? no bean sprouts for my pho?   bean sprouts are like that rug that really tied the room together.  it is a requirement.  so i looked around the restaurant in a panic and noticed two homeboys in the corner finishing up their pho's.  and they had a full plate of bean sprouts.  the old man begged me not to go over  (he gets embarrassed really easily) but i did and the guys were happy to give me their goods.  they really saved the moment.  
unfortunately, it wasn't enough to save the night.  i ate half my pho and it was good, but nothing to write home about.  not that anyone at home in lowell, ma even knows what the heck pho is.  by the time we got to the car, my lips were swelling and itchy.  by the time we got home, i was in full blown food allergy attack.  dammit.
so not only did i not get kevin's that night, and have to eat sloppy seconds bean sprouts, i had to drink half a bottle of liquid benedryl to stay alive.  

moral of the story...go to kevin's.
author: Katie H.

description:
when one is cold, one craves soup, and i crave pho ... 
when one is hot, one craves froyo (check next review: http://www.yelp.com/biz/icebee-san-francisco#hrid:KASal9vudDOgjNZrtMbrNQ)

today's lunch? i was definitely not a happy camper...  VERY DISAPPOINTED... 

pho no good ...

what the PHO?

just like any other pho ... 

why the hype? really, yo no comprende sir ...

i gave in ... 

to me, pho is pho ... the only difference from one pho to another is honestly HOW CLEAN the broth is ... to me that is ... 

i don't think i've ever paid $12 for a freakin bowl of vermicelli...  get this ... i got their  #15 (imperial rolls and charboiled pork, but in LA, i request extra charboiled beef with it) and the most i paid was up to $7. PPQ apparently charges you up for $4 for it... sneaky shady folks not telling us folks ... sure, it says it on the menu, but u should also tell the patrons, IMHO ... 

their pho? you're looking at $8 for a bowl of LARGE pho ... 

not worth it ... 

makes me want to REALLY move back down to LA even more ..

what da PHO?
author: Jennifer S.

description: The vermicelli (bun) and rice plates are so good and cheap here. I've ordered the 5-spice chicken bun like 10 out of the 15 times I've been here.
author: Retired B.

description:
The Pho is *not* so pho-tastic! Okay, I have been to this place a few times, and I haven't been impressed with their service or food.  I will give this place 1 kudo however, but then it is downhill from there.  The only positive I find about this place, is that it's open until 11pm, and for some reason I always find my tummy rumbling late at night, so this was a desirable attribute to me --- the food however -- NOT SO MUCH!!  My favorite pho dish is the well done beef brisket, but theirs is riddled with nasty fat and rare meat. I know usually the meat will cook in the broth, but the pieces of meat they put in the soup look like discarded meat you would give to your dog. GROSS!!!!  Anyway, I know that you can't judge a place based on the first time you have eaten there, so I tried ordering the pho a second time. Unfortunately, I ordered the spicy pho, which was so spicy you couldn't even eat it with a full glass of water, and the noodles were way overdone. The only semi-positive meal I had at this place was the 5 spice chicken pho -- which was just okay.  After getting my inedible meal from the waitress, I asked for a plain bowl of pho. She basically found the smallest bowl in the place and filled it with just noodles, and a tiny bit of broth that immediately soaked directly into the noodles, she just placed it on the table and didn't even ask us if that's what we wanted, just assumed. Who just orders a side of vermicelli noodles, and overdone vermicelli noodles at that? -- a la Celeste

********************************************
Skip this place, you can find better pho places in the city that are just as affordable. Head down to some of the better rated ones in the Tenderloin, its a bit of trip from the Sunset and not the best part of town but better than settling for this tripe!  ---- a la Ronan (irish lova)
author: Celeste O.

description: its pretty Pho king good for the Pho king price.  authentic so please give your soup bowls, chopsticks and spoons a good wipe-down.
author: John P.

description: Better than any other pho joint I've been to in Boston, New York, Cleveland, Seattle, or Los Angeles. And at $5.95 for a "small" bowl, it's value. Service isn't great, but you get your food quickly.
author: A. T.

description: yummy and affordable.  excellent pho on a cold winter night.. or cold vermicelli w/ grilled beef, washed down with a lemon soda in the summer.. there's always enough for a to go for lunch tomorrow serving.  i like that they are cash only too.. less $$ to some big credit card corporation and more to the owner..
author: Claire U.

description: Completely rude/annoying. We go in talk to a lady that seems to be doing the seating and request a table for two and wait a few minutes for a couple that was in front of us to be seated at a freed table and another  10 or so for a second small table to open up. by this time there are several groups waiting for tables. A second lady walks out of the back up to an Asian couple who had walked in the door a minute or two earlier and points at them and then points to the table that was being cleared without asking or checking with anyone else waiting to see who was there the longest. We mention that we'd been there much longer than the couple she had just seated and she just blankly stared at us for a second. I liked the PPQ crab place, food was great and the couple in front of us had great things to say about it, but fuck that. I have no desire to wait another 15 minutes after a table is take out from under us. I have no plans to return and have taken the crab one on Clement off of the list of places I want to take my gf...
author: Ross M.

description: if you're coming down with a cold or flu or SARS or you're just in need of some nourishment after a hard weekend of partying, nothing is more healing than broth and spicy stuff. i love me some vietnamese and even though it makes me a little squeamish, thinking my rare flank steak pho is tainted with dog meat, this place is de-lish. oh my the imperial rolls are DFL. holy crap fried delights! the shrimp fresh rolls are A-OK too because man does not thrive on fried alone. the 5 spice chicken indeed is awesome, and i usually get the flank steak/meatball pho. large portions for cheap and it's always packed = all good pluses in my book.
author: Mary V.

description: my brother introduced this place to me. serves really good food, but it's usually a crowd and it's not so roomy. all the times, i've been here it was a good experience. so far so good. yummy.
author: Valerie N.

description: yummy! new at pho. i had the vegetable tofu noodle soup. usually i like meat, but after stuffing myself with mom's chilaquilas and dad's clay pot ham on easter -- i felt the need for some veggies. noodles, broccoli, tofu, (& some vegetable that i should be familiar with, but alas i am not.) it was very filling, i couldn't even finish it. ppq was pretty crowded with happy customers, but  service was quick and pleasant. the decor was like an upscale vietnamese diner. my ppq experience was a great for a pho beginner, and now that the sunset branch library has reopened -- i will be definitely be back.
author: Tanya V.

description: We were lucky to get the last available table because it seemed like people had to wait for awhile after us on a Friday night.  Pho was great and the BBQ was great.  Really liked the broth.  Service was ok....what do you expect from an Asian restaurant.  Price is a little higher than average, but food was good.
author: Mich C.

description: best dish there is the Chicken Curry Noodles...HANDS DOWN! It's so popular that sometimes they run out of it. Definitely one of my fav places for noodles.
author: Sara L.

description: Been coming here regularly after a night of drinking for almost a year now and then this weekend, we find something in our Satay Beef Noodle that shouldn't be in there.  This thing can't be killed with a swat of a slipper (requires at least steel toe boot).  I must really like this place b/c we actually send it back and order another one and yes, we ate the replacement.  Funny thing was, we got takeout and my typically super anal girlfriend actually scooped it out and pondered for 1/2 a second as to whether we should just heat up the noodles and eat it with some consideration that heat kills the germs of insects.  Either that or we would give it to her father to eat.  I mean, it's like a 2 mile drive and difficult to find parking and we were hungry and...  She didn't say it, but I could see it in her face and she could see it in mine.  Not "that" good but "good enough" to actually ponder that thought for a split second.   They did give us our money back and replace our food, and yes, we still ended up eating food from there and yes, it was pretty damn good (though neither of us was able to finish the food b/c the image of the floating insect lingered).  So we gave them a mulligan.  And yes, aren't i lucky to have this girl?  Honestly, this place is good, as the long line outside waits and I don't want to shut down a well-liked family restaurant.  I mean, I was in Chinatown and saw a giant cockroach sashay across the wall as we were ordering.  Everyone paused, shrugged, and ended up ordering a full midnight snack.  Does this make me a bad person?  I mean, it's 2 a.m., what is the cockroach supposed to do?  Hide until dawn?  As i write this review, I came to the realization that I will be not be going to either ppq or the chinese restaurant again... anytime soon.
author: Scott Y.

description: I am always pleased when I eat here, however, so is everyone else causing me to wait for seating. Luckily, we got there just in time last night - right before the rag-tag high school kids about 5 minutes after we were seated. I have been nursing one muthafucka of a cold and I have been a 5 day ramen noodle kick so I figure to kick it up a notch and celebrate the end of my sickness w/a bowl of seafood pho and a bottle of Tsing Tao. The appetizer of veggie fried rolls were also good despite it's greasy appearance but aren't most things delicious when it's been fried to an inch of it's life? Exactly! I enjoy eating fishballs (insert smart ass remark) and fish cake so this soup was very pleasing to me. In the past I have had the pho w/raw beef and the 5 spice chicken - I've never been disappointed. I did notice that the broth is much more tasty when it's hot and not tepid. Living two blocks up from this place is the added bonus!
author: Alexis D.

description: A good variety of pho soups, with lots of delicious extras.
author: Thomas P.

description: the pho and the 5 spice chicken are quite tasty!  cheers to the fact that it keeps late hours.
author: Dorothy L.

description: The #5 satay noodle soup is my favorite. I come here everytime i'm back in the city. Be forwarned: do not wear white and anticipate splash stains!
author: Lauren K.

description:
i think this place has the best cleanest tasting pho in sf.   i might be wrong, but that would only be out of ignorance of other places i haven't visited.  for 6 bucks for a small pho which is actually a medium at other places, this is very high quality.  also tried the bun and i think it rivals tulan's, plus it doesn't feel like cockroaches were running around on your food.   

i love this place.  i do love kevin's too so check it out.
author: shar d.

description: Like everyone else, love their Five Spice Chicken and the Imperial Rolls! But a friend introduced me to their "Curry Noodle Soup with Chicken". I think it's #8 on the Pho/Noodles list. Delicious! Perfect amount of curry, coconut milk and spices! This will cure what ails ya.
author: Dedicated E.

description: i only go here because i live couple blocks away and it's easy for me to just walk out and grab soemthign to eat first. i realized that the service is ok, but i know someone that works there so it's alright. the food pretty damn tasty but the price is a little higher compared to all the pho restaurants on irving. i usually order #1 which is very good. but i think they are pretty cheap, almost no meat and only ONE BEEF ball. (CHEAP)... only for quick eat, don't take the food too serious
author: Eric Y.

description: love their five spices chicken noodle soup.  skin is crispy, meat is juicy.  perfect combination with the pho.....YUM.  gonna go get some now!
author: Allene J.

description: PPQ has yummy chicken noodle soup and a great vermacelli salad.  All the noodle soups come in a small (around $5.50) or large size ($7.00).  The portions are huge.  Since the line is always out the door, I always pick up the food.  The only draw back is the place accepts cash only.
author: c v.

description: ive been to my fair share of pho joints, and im gonna have to say that this place looked the best and tasted the best. i know that u can't really mess up pho, but with so many places to choose from, this place definitely did a good job. the place is super clean unlike some places, they're open late and the pho is good. it's nice to have a go to pho spot now. i'll be there to cure my next hangover.
author: cj b.

description: Love this place! Worth the wait if there's a line -- fresh, consistent quality food with friendly fast service! You won't be disappointed!
author: SF L.

description: i think this place was pretty good.I'd be interested to go back and try different variations they offer on their pho bc i think i just picked a boring one .it was good, meat left a little something to be desired, but it was alright enough.i am going to try the carpaccio per christina s' advice though next time !
author: Lauren V.

description: 3.5 Stars. not a bad bowl of pho... pretty tasty, prices have risen just like everywhere else. My personal favorite is the five spice chicken pho... it's almost as if i get the best of both worlds..i want five spice chicken bun and a bowl of pho.......... gracias. not the best pho i've had in SF, but definitely has a clean taste. Good for one of those days you have a headache and it's cold & you need something to warm that lil belly ballooning from SF food up...
author: Jeannette L.

description: Great, consistent and cheap - exactly what you want for a Pho joint. Definitely my fav in SF. Great Pho, spicy curry sup and of course imperial roles. Defiantly worth a visit and the short wait!
author: Monique D.

description: I'm not sure why people come here for pho when there is pho hoa hiep across the street. That place has more selection, better prices, and overall tastier pho. I come here for their roast pork in clay pot. That dish is amazing! Unfortunately, I don't think it's on the menu anymore. Since then, I have been able to order it once and not the other time. I hope they bring it back. If you're reading, bring back Roast Pork in Clay Pot!!!
author: Luke F.

description: To go-to place for pho in the Sunset.  Tasty, if a little over MSG'd.
author: John C.

description: For many years our favorite Vietnamese restaurant has been PPQ. As regulars, we tend to order the same dishes - the curry chicken vermicelli soup (a very spicy, complex soup with white tender pieces of chicken and spices); the beef papaya salad; and the crab-tofu ball tomato based soup. The imperial rolls are savory. Looking around, it seems that everyone has their favorite 'regular' dishes - and people eat with great enjoyment, including ourselves.
author: Tamara F.

description: PPQ is always crowded and i hate waiting! but it's worth it, most of the time. Sometimes the service is slow and you have to wait so long to get there attention. I really like there food here especially the curry chicken or five spice chicken pho.
author: Ally W.

description: I love this place. I come here AT LEAST once a week for noodles. Everything is fresh and healthy. The service is fast and friendly, and they know me well enough...maybe because I almost always order a large #4 with asparagas and a soy milk. But occasionally I go wild and order a #2 or maybe a beer. ;)
author: Mark M.

description: The pho here tasted mediocre, I had better. Service was ok, atmosphere nice is laid back and nice (kinda loud but which pho place isn't like that?), I did get burn on the face with broth (another story and not the restaurant fault) . My only complaint is that its own by chinese  (maybe thats why more chinese go here than viets?). Doesn't really taste authentic. I guess to me pho taste better when it's made by vietnamese people. I also think that they could've done better with the 6 dollar bowls. Other places you get a whole lot more stuff in it for the same price.
author: Thu-Nhi D.

description: I ate here on Friday and it was packed, but we didn't have to wait long. I had the 5 spice chicken rice plate and thai tea. It was AWESOME. Thai tea was a bit sweet, but it had ice, and I LOVE ICE! I love chewing on ice, but I have to stop chewing on ice since my parents had to dish out 1k to pay for my root canal(that hurt like hell), because I chewed on ice too much 0_0! Yeah, well anyways good food and good pho:)
author: Lola Y.

description: great prices, great food....come here for the BBQ charbroiled pork, sping roll w/ vermicelli. pretty sure this is a popular dish here. service is so, so but does not matter too much...
author: Deo V.

description: wow. great prices and great pho. i got the spring rolls and the flank, tripe, and tendon pho. amazing.
author: Matt R.

description: great local place for a hot steamy bowl of soup especially on a  cold foggy night in the sunset.  the curry vermicilli soup is the utlitmate nice and spicy and keeps me full for the entire evening.  check out this place for cheap eats, but its cash only so bring it with you.
author: matt j.
